title: Bühler Industries (Bühler brand coverage) announces amalgamation/going-private agreement
summary: Reports indicate Bühler Industries (manufacturer of Versatile and Farm King) reached an amalgamation agreement with majority owner ASKO/Newco to take the Canadian-listed company private to enable faster investment decisions for factory modernization and new product development; management said the move supports capacity expansion and product launches while preserving dealer networks[1]. This concerns the affiliated Bühler Industries business rather than the Swiss Bühler Group corporate entity and is primarily a corporate-structure/ownership transaction reported in the agricultural-equipment press[1].

title: Bühler will not pass full 39% tariff to customers, uses supply-chain measures to mitigate cost
summary: Bühler stated it will absorb a portion of a 39% tariff rather than pass the full cost to customers and will utilize supply-chain strategies to mitigate the impact, signaling efforts to protect customers from abrupt price increases amid trade-cost pressures[4]. This is an operational/market-impact update on pricing strategy rather than new financing or regulatory change by authorities[4].

title: Bühler Southern Africa reports strong 2025 performance on innovation and local investment
summary: Bühler Southern Africa published a year-end report noting solid momentum in 2025 despite global volatility, highlighting investments in local capability and innovation that supported business resilience and customer projects[2]. The item is positioned as corporate-year performance/news rather than a financial filing with new funding details[2].

title: Bühler appoints Mike Häfeli as CEO of Grains & Food (effective end of 2025)
summary: Bühler Group announced that Mike Häfeli will become CEO of its Grains & Food division as Johannes Wick steps down after a decade and transitions to a new role at the company; the release frames this as a planned leadership succession to continue strategic momentum into 2026[7]. The appointment is presented as an internal leadership change with continuity emphasis rather than an abrupt replacement[7].

title: The Cultured Hub expands into plant cell culturing capabilities
summary: The Cultured Hub — a joint venture including Bühler, Migros and Givaudan — announced an expansion of its service offering to include plant cell culturing capabilities to support scaling of plant-cell–derived ingredients such as cocoa and coffee; Bühler highlighted the move as addressing supply resilience and enabling access to advanced bioprocess equipment and expertise for innovators in plant cell-based production[6][3]. The announcement notes technical and cost challenges remain (sterile bioreactors, energy-intensive environments), and frames the expansion as a neutral platform to help scale lab results toward industrial adoption[6][3].

title: Maryland Landfill Selects Waga Energy for Renewable Natural Gas Production
summary: A Maryland landfill has chosen Waga Energy to produce renewable natural gas, advancing waste-to-energy initiatives.[1]

title: Colorado Approves Updated Rules to Reduce Landfill Methane Emissions
summary: Colorado has approved new rules aimed at reducing methane emissions from landfills, representing a key regulatory development in waste management.[1]

title: Kansas City to Receive $5M EPA Grant
summary: Kansas City, Missouri, is set to receive a $5 million grant from the EPA, as noted in recent industry updates, supporting waste management initiatives.[1]

title: EPA Settles with CIL Electroplating for Hazardous Waste Violations
summary: The EPA reached a settlement on December 19, 2025, with CIL Electroplating in Massachusetts over RCRA violations including improper hazardous waste container storage, labeling, and training. The company will pay a $136,383 civil penalty and has certified return to compliance.[6]

title: Circular Services Acquires Atlas Organics from Generate Upcycle
summary: Circular Services bought Atlas Organics on November 6, 2025, nearly four years after Generate Upcycle's parent acquired a majority stake, aiming to grow operations within its existing footprint in the organics composting sector.[2]

title: IWS and Waste Connections Acquire NYC Assets Amid Commercial Waste Shift
summary: IWS and Waste Connections are purchasing assets and routes from competitors in New York City, including a Queens transfer station on November 25, 2025, to expand in the shifting commercial waste market. Additional acquisitions are expected.[2]

title: BLT Enterprises Secures $10 Million Financing for Major Facility Upgrades
summary: BLT Enterprises obtained $10 million in financing from City National Bank to upgrade its Santa Monica material recovery facility with AI-enabled optical sorters, robots, solar power improvements, and employee amenities. More than $3 million in improvements were completed by September 30, 2025, with robotics installation planned by year-end to boost recycling efficiency.[1]

title: ZainTECH Partners with Vortex Global to Launch AI-Powered Video Compression and Analytics
summary: On December 19, 2025, ZainTECH announced a partnership with Vortex Global to introduce advanced video compression and AI analytics solutions. The deal incorporates Vortex's flagship technologies into ZainTECH's portfolio, targeting optimized performance in data-driven environments. This move supports broader digital transformation goals.

title: ZainTECH and Vortex Global Announce Strategic Partnership to Revolutionize Video Compression and AI Visual Intelligence
summary: ZainTECH, the digital solutions arm of Zain Group, has partnered with Vortex Global to integrate Vortex's 'Z Compress' and 'Twin Vision' technologies for AI-powered video compression and visual analytics. The collaboration, announced at GITEX GLOBAL 2025 in Dubai on December 18, 2025, aims to enhance enterprise safety, efficiency, and decision-making across sectors. CEOs from both companies highlighted the partnership's role in advancing digital intelligence and regional expansion.

title: Vacuum Pumps Market Competition Analysis 2025 - How Players Are Shaping Growth
summary: The Vacuum Pumps market is led by Atlas Copco with energy-efficient, oil-free technologies for semiconductors and pharma; firms are pursuing innovations like ULVAC's Gv135 pump. Growth focuses on sustainability, smart systems, and strategic partnerships amid rising demand. The report forecasts trends through 2034 with moderate consolidation expected.

title: Semiconductor Vacuum Chuck Market Set to Double to USD 2.4 Billion by 2034
summary: The global Semiconductor Vacuum Chuck Market is projected to grow from USD 1.2 billion to USD 2.4 billion by 2034, driven by rising semiconductor production, chip miniaturization, and demand in automotive, electronics, and AI sectors. Key segments include electrostatic chucks for wafer handling, with major players like Applied Materials and ASML leading. Challenges include supply chain issues, but opportunities exist in AI automation and eco-friendly materials.

title: Best New Vacuum Trends of CES 2025 – Robotic Arms, Retractable LiDAR, Threshold Crossing and More
summary: CES 2025 highlighted innovations in robot vacuums including robotic arms from Roborock (Saros series) and Dreame (X50 Ultra with Pro Leap system), plus threshold-crossing tech from Eureka's J15 Max Ultra. Trends focus on advanced navigation, modular attachments, and AI for spills. These developments signal a surge in home-cleaning robot capabilities.

title: CoreFlow Unveils NEW 310 mm × 310 mm Vacuum Stage to Solve Major Warpage Challenges in CoPoS Panel-Level Packaging
summary: CoreFlow launched a new 310 mm × 310 mm Vacuum Stage for precise, clamp-free flattening of warped glass substrates in CoPoS packaging processes. Derived from proven 300mm wafer technology, it supports higher device density for AI applications and integrates with existing fab systems. Available now in Selective Vacuum or GripJet configurations with 8-12 week delivery.

title: Nilfisk Launches VP25 Robotic Vacuum For The Professional Cleaning Market
summary: Nilfisk announced the launch of the VP25, an industrial-grade robotic vacuum designed for high-traffic areas like offices, hospitality, and retail. It features 2D/3D LiDAR, HEPA filtering, a 5.3-gallon dust bag, and up to 3 hours of runtime, building on the SC25 robotic scrubber platform. The product aims to boost productivity and maintain clean environments with minimal human intervention.

title: Vuzix Pursues Strategic Partnerships and Growth in Competitive AR Market Despite 14.93% Stock Dip
summary: On December 24, 2025, Vuzix Corporation's stock fell -14.93% amid market demand concerns, with profitability issues highlighted by a -120.4% gross margin and $7.3M net loss. The company is focusing on R&D investments of $2.94M and forging new partnerships to advance AR products and achieve long-term growth.

title: Vuzix Corporation Stock Drops 15.64% Amid Geopolitical Tensions and Market Volatility
summary: Vuzix Corporation (NASDAQ: VUZI) experienced a significant stock decline of -15.64% on December 24, 2025, due to geopolitical tensions affecting tech markets. Despite financial challenges including an EBIT margin of -713.1% and net losses of -$7.35M, the company is pursuing strategic expansions and new partnerships to drive future growth.

title: VA to Improve Health Care Choice and Quality with New Community Care Contracts
summary: VA announced new community care contracts aimed at enhancing health care choice and quality for veterans. This update seeks to expand access beyond traditional VA facilities. It represents a strategic shift in service delivery.

title: House Republicans Launch Veteran First Initiative to Modernize VA Healthcare
summary: Chairman Bost and House Republicans introduced bills to reauthorize and improve VA healthcare delivery, including drug formulary, leasing, research, and procurement processes. The initiative addresses bureaucratic hurdles to prioritize veterans. It aligns with Secretary Collins' vision for updated VA programs.

title: VA Deputy Secretary Discusses 2025 Accomplishments and 2026 Goals on Federal EHR Update
summary: VA Deputy Secretary Paul Lawrence highlighted 2025 achievements and outlined 2026 goals in the Federal Electronic Health Record Update program. He noted improvements in EHR technology, positive shifts in staff sentiment from site visits, and emphasized user engagement for better veteran care. Lawrence stressed ongoing system updates and communication efforts.

title: Senators Demand Answers on VA's Plan to Eliminate Tens of Thousands of Health Care Jobs
summary: Senators led by Blumenthal expressed concern over a reported VA plan to cut up to 35,000 vacant health care positions by year-end, following a Washington Post article. This comes after over 40,000 employee departures in FY 2025 due to hiring freezes and policy changes. Critics warn it will strain an already thin workforce.

title: VA Launches Veterans Health Administration Reorganization
summary: The Department of Veterans Affairs announced a reorganization of the Veterans Health Administration to be implemented over the next 18-24 months. This initiative aims to improve healthcare delivery for veterans amid ongoing operational challenges. Congress is also proposing reauthorization measures to support VA functions.

title: USDA History Preserved at National Agricultural Library Highlighted in Recent Article
summary: A Farm Progress article on December 20, 2025, discusses how the USDA National Agricultural Library preserves historical USDA materials. It underscores the library's role in maintaining agricultural history amid ongoing operations. No specific new developments or changes are detailed beyond preservation efforts.

title: USDA National Agricultural Library Cancels Nearly 400 Journal Subscriptions Amid Cost-Cutting Drive
summary: The USDA has canceled subscriptions to nearly 400 journals at its National Agricultural Library as part of the Trump administration's efforts to reduce federal spending, supervised by the Department of Government Efficiency. The cancellations affect journals from 17 publishers, leaving staff with access only to back issues from 2023 or earlier, prompting criticism from scientists who call it a hasty move that undermines research. USDA may consider restoring some based on quick justifications submitted by staff.

title: US Durum Products Celebrates Expansion in Harrisburg with State Leaders
summary: Governor Josh Shapiro and Lieutenant Governor Austin Davis announced US Durum's move to 523 South 17th Street in Harrisburg, enhancing manufacturing with advanced technologies. Local leaders including Senator Patty Kim and Representative Dave Madsen highlighted job growth and economic benefits for Pennsylvania farmers and families. The family-owned couscous manufacturer aims to strengthen its community role.

title: Shapiro-Davis Administration Secures $8M Investment from US Durum Products for Expansion and Job Creation
summary: US Durum Products is investing $8,036,000 to relocate from Lancaster County to a larger facility in Harrisburg, Pennsylvania, modernizing operations with new equipment to boost production and efficiency. The project will create and retain 64 jobs over three years, supported by a $140,000 commonwealth investment. CEO Said Chergui expressed gratitude for the support in serving the global customer base.

title: UK Bread and Flour Regulations Amended to Mandate Folic Acid Fortification from End of 2026
summary: Amendments to the 1998 Bread and Flour Regulations now apply in England, Scotland, and Wales, requiring UK millers to fortify non-wholemeal wheat flour with folic acid starting end of 2026 to protect baby health. Most millers implemented this in 2025, necessitating immediate label updates upon receiving fortified flour. Exemptions apply to small-scale millers producing under 500 tonnes annually, with new enforcement via Improvement Notices.

title: Richardson International Completes Acquisition of 8th Avenue Pasta Business Including Durum Mill
summary: Richardson International has finalized its $375 million purchase of the 8th Avenue pasta business from Post Holdings, which includes a durum mill. The transaction, announced in early December 2025, marks a significant expansion in Richardson's pasta and durum milling operations. This deal involves key assets in the North American pasta sector.

title: Shapiro-Davis Administration Secures $8 Million Investment from US Durum Products to Expand Manufacturing and Create Jobs
summary: US Durum Products is investing $8,036,000 to relocate and expand operations from Lancaster County to a larger facility in Harrisburg, Pennsylvania, modernizing with new equipment to boost production and efficiency. The project will create and retain 64 jobs over three years, supported by a $140,000 commonwealth investment. CEO Said Chergui expressed enthusiasm for contributing to the local community.

title: U.S. Self-Storage Transaction Volume Reaches $5.9 Billion as of November 21, 2025
summary: Self-storage transaction volume across the U.S. hit $5.9 billion by November 21, 2025, surpassing the prior year's full-year total. Rents rose 0.6% year-over-year to $16.38 per square foot. The under-construction pipeline remains stable at 53.3 million square feet.

title: Basis Industrial Secures $102 Million Refinance for Six-State Self-Storage Portfolio
summary: Basis Industrial refinanced a 785,522 square foot self-storage portfolio across six states. Blackrock provided the $102 million financing. This supports ongoing operations in the temporary storage sector.

title: Storelocal Storage Acquires Cibolo Storage Facility in Texas
summary: Storelocal Storage, operating 91 facilities in 19 states, acquired Cibolo Storage in Cibolo, Texas. The 28,000 square foot property includes nine buildings with 246 drive-up units. The transaction was brokered by Cunningham, Karr and investment specialists.

title: Hearthfire Holdings Acquires 92,375 Sq Ft StoreSpace Self Storage in Taylor, Michigan
summary: Hearthfire Holdings, a real estate and private-equity firm, purchased a newly built 92,375 square foot climate-controlled facility in Taylor, Michigan. The property will be managed by Extra Space Storage Inc. Hearthfire has acquired 22 facilities across eight states since 2019.

title: National Storage Affiliates Trust Acquires Three Facilities in Q1 2025 Despite Soft Performance
summary: NSAT reported a 5.7% decline in same-store NOI and 83.6% occupancy in Q1 2025 but remains focused on disciplined growth. The company acquired three facilities, prioritizing assets in top 100 MSAs. This strategy counters near-term headwinds.

title: Public Storage Posts Positive Move-In Trends and Acquires Nine Properties in Early 2025
summary: Public Storage reported positive move-in trends and narrowing occupancy gaps in early 2025, with Core FFO impacted by FX losses but offset by NOI gains. The REIT acquired at least nine properties and has 3.5 million square feet under development. Foot traffic exceeded 2024 levels and rose 2% from Q1 2019.

title: Extra Space Storage Reports Strong Q1 2025 Results with 12 Acquisitions and Third-Party Management Expansion
summary: Extra Space Storage achieved 93.7% occupancy and 2% year-over-year Core FFO growth in Q1 2025, driven by revenue management and Life Storage integration. The company completed 12 acquisitions and added over 100 facilities to its third-party management platform. This reflects a focus on balanced growth amid selective investments.

title: SkyBitz Introduces the ST705 Radar Monitor: A C1D1, Non-Invasive Solution for Accurate, Real-Time Tank Monitoring
summary: SkyBitz, a Telular company under AMETEK, launched the ST705 Radar Monitor on December 18, 2025, offering a C1D1-compliant, non-invasive tank monitoring solution for precise real-time data. This product launch builds on recent strong corporate developments including record Q3 earnings and sustainability initiatives. It enhances tank monitoring capabilities for industries like propane and logistics.

title: Haver & Boecker Niagara Offers Rhino Hyde Liners Through Partnership with Tandem Products
summary: Haver & Boecker Niagara is now offering Rhino Hyde liners, including custom-made Blue liners with various backings, through their partnership with Tandem Products Inc. This collaboration expands access to Rhino Hyde's polyurethane wear protection solutions. The announcement highlights ongoing product integration post-acquisition.

title: Tandem Adds Support for the CRI Profile Through Cyber Risk Institute Membership
summary: Tandem has become an Affiliate Member of the Cyber Risk Institute (CRI), enabling full support for the CRI Profile within its Cybersecurity Assessment product. This enhances Tandem's offerings in cybersecurity risk management. The update positions Tandem to better serve clients in compliance and risk assessment.

title: Haver & Boecker Niagara Acquires Partial Ownership in Tandem Products Inc.
summary: Haver & Boecker Niagara, a leader in screening and pelletizing technologies since 1872, has acquired partial ownership in Tandem Products Inc. This strategic move strengthens their position in related industrial technologies. The announcement highlights ongoing expansion in the sector.

title: Rosen Law Firm Encourages Tandem Diabetes Care Investors to Inquire About Securities Class Action Investigation
summary: Rosen Law Firm is investigating potential securities claims against Tandem Diabetes Care (TNDM) over allegations of materially misleading business information related to a voluntary medical device correction for select t:slim X2 insulin pumps announced on August 7, 2025. The correction addressed a speaker-related issue that could discontinue insulin delivery, causing the stock to fall 19.9% that day. This notice was issued on December 25, 2025.

title: Mark Foods, Bristol Seafood Join Parade of US Businesses Suing Over Trump Tariffs
summary: Mark Foods and its acquired entity Bristol Seafood are part of a coalition of US companies filing suit against new Trump administration tariffs. The tariffs target seafood imports, prompting legal challenges from affected businesses. The case underscores tensions in the seafood sector over trade barriers.

title: Mark Foods and Bristol Seafood File Lawsuit Against Trump Tariffs
summary: Mark Foods and Bristol Seafood have joined other US businesses in filing a lawsuit challenging Trump tariffs. The legal action aims to contest the imposed tariffs affecting their seafood import operations. This move highlights growing industry opposition to the trade policies.

title: Mennel Hosts Fourth Annual Leave a Legacy Charitable Giving Campaign
summary: Mennel Milling hosted its fourth annual Leave a Legacy charitable giving campaign from November 7-30, 2025. The initiative reflects the company's ongoing commitment to community support and corporate social responsibility.

title: Mennel Milling Completes Acquisition of Mondelez International's Toledo Flour Mill
summary: Mennel Milling Company has completed the acquisition of the Toledo Flour Mill from Mondelez International, a major facility in East Toledo, Ohio, with a capacity of up to 4 million pounds of soft wheat flour per day. This move solidifies Mennel's position as the fourth-largest milling company in the US, enhancing production capacity and market reach while ensuring continuity for existing customers. CEO D. Ford Mennel highlighted the strategic growth and commitment to customer needs amid competitive pressures.

title: Sweet by Behlen and Behlen Grain Systems Visit BinVista Installation Honoring W. Dean Sweet
summary: Team members from Sweet by Behlen and Behlen Grain Systems visited a new BinVista installation at the Clark County Fairgrounds on July 28, 2025, honoring W. Dean Sweet. The event highlights ongoing collaboration and recognition of Sweet's legacy post-acquisition. It showcases client success stories and the impact of their solutions.

title: Sweet Manufacturing Officially Joins Behlen Mfg. Co. Family as of February 28, 2025
summary: Sweet Manufacturing has officially joined the Behlen Mfg. Co. family effective February 28, 2025, marking the completion of the previously announced acquisition. This partnership unites two industry leaders in grain, feed, and industrial storage solutions, with Sweet-branded products continuing at the Springfield, OH location. The move expands Behlen's footprint and offerings in the agricultural manufacturing sector.

title: Supreme Rice LLC Receives 2025 USA Rice Sustainability Award
summary: Supreme Rice was awarded the 2025 USA Rice Sustainability Award for its partnerships with farmers, promotion of conservation, and initiatives like the Climate-Smart Initiative funded by a 2023 grant. The recognition highlights their efforts in soil health, wildlife habitat, and supporting small farms through custom harvesting. The award was announced at the 2025 USA Rice Outlook Conference on December 12.

title: Supreme Rice Invests $16.2 Million to Create Parboil Facilities and Expand Product Line
summary: Supreme Rice is investing $16.2 million to develop parboil facilities in Crowley and Mermentau, Louisiana, for a new line of ready-to-eat rice products. The project will create 20 direct jobs and nearly 100 total jobs while retaining 181 existing positions. Construction is set to begin in Q4 this year.

title: Superior Industries International Inc. Downgraded to 'SD' from 'CC' on Distressed Debt Exchange
summary: S&P Global downgraded Superior Industries International Inc.'s rating to 'SD' (Selective Default) from 'CC' due to a distressed debt exchange linked to the recent acquisition. This reflects the company's financial restructuring efforts. The downgrade occurred on December 10, 2025.

title: Superior Industries International Announces Board and Executive Changes
summary: On December 8, 2025, Superior Industries International Inc. announced significant updates to its board and executive team alongside the CEO transition. These changes support the company's strategic shift following the acquisition closing. Details on new board members were not specified in announcements.

title: Superior Industries Announces Closing of Acquisition by Group of Existing Term Loan Investors
summary: Superior Industries has closed its acquisition by a group of existing term loan investors, strengthening its balance sheet and providing flexibility for investments in operations and customer relationships. New CEO Michael Dorah highlighted the transaction as a turning point, positioning the company for growth in the global wheel industry. Advisors including Lazard, Alvarez & Marsal, and law firms facilitated the deal.

title: Superior Industries International Announces CEO Transition Effective December 8, 2025
summary: Majdi Abulaban has stepped down as Chief Executive Officer, and Michael Dorah, previously the Chief Operating Officer with over 30 years in the automotive supply business, has been appointed as the new CEO effective immediately. This change coincides with a major acquisition closing. The company expressed thanks to Abulaban for his service.

title: J.C. Snavely & Sons, Inc. Celebrated by LMC for Reaching 147 Years in Business in 2025
summary: J.C. Snavely & Sons, Inc., founded in 1878, is recognized by LMC Dealers for achieving over 100 years in business, now in its fifth generation of family leadership. The full-service lumber and building materials supplier from Landisville, PA, exemplifies resilience and commitment to quality service for builders and contractors. LMC honors its enduring success amid industry challenges.

title: Snavely Forest Products Forges Strategic Partnership with Allura USA to Distribute Fiber Cement Siding in Texas and Oklahoma City
summary: Snavely Forest Products, a subsidiary of MacArthur Co., is now distributing Allura's full line of fiber cement siding and trim in North and South-Central Texas and Oklahoma City markets. The partnership broadens Snavely's offerings for builders and contractors with durable, low-maintenance products. Clark Spitzer emphasized alignment with best-in-class manufacturers to deliver premium solutions in growth markets.

title: Snavely Forest Products Announces Partnership with Weyerhaeuser to Distribute Trus Joist Engineered Wood Products in Eastern Markets
summary: Snavely Forest Products has partnered with Weyerhaeuser to distribute Trus Joist branded engineered wood products, including TJI joists and LVL, through its centers in Maryland, North Carolina, and Pittsburgh. Clark Spitzer, President of Snavely, highlighted the opportunity to grow volumes and serve the Mid-Atlantic with high-performance solutions. The move strengthens Snavely's portfolio and commitment to quality and innovation.

title: Team BDS Officially Rebrands as Shifters
summary: The Swiss esports organization Team BDS has fully rebranded to Shifters across its competitive teams and branding. The change has sparked amusement and reactions within the esports community.

title: Boukada Joins Shifters as Jungler for 2025 League of Legends Season
summary: Boukada transferred to Shifters in December 2025, a team rebranding from BDS following organizational changes. This executive change strengthens the team's roster for the upcoming season.

title: Siemens Mobility Secures ETCS Level 2 Contract for Digitalizing Rail in Chile
summary: Siemens Mobility won its first European Train Control System Level 2 project in Chile on December 1, 2025, to digitalize rail operations in Latin America.

title: Tobias Bauer Named President and CEO of Siemens Mobility North America
summary: Effective December 1, 2025, Tobias Bauer has been appointed President and Chief Executive Officer of Siemens Mobility North America. He brings over 20 years of experience to the role.

title: Siemens Mobility to Source Green Steel from Voestalpine for Rail Production
summary: Siemens Mobility signed an agreement with Voestalpine to increase green steel usage to at least 20% in rail vehicle production by 2025, expanding a pilot project. The deal includes CO2-reduced steel with up to 70% lower emissions. This supports Siemens' goals of 90% CO2 reduction by 2030 and carbon neutrality by 2050.

title: Siemens Mobility Signs Strategic Partnership with VinSpeed for Vietnam High-Speed Rail
summary: Siemens Mobility has partnered with VinSpeed to develop Vietnam's first high-speed rail lines, providing Velaro Novo trains, ETCS Level 2 signaling, and other subsystems. The agreement aims to enhance connectivity and sustainable transport. CEOs highlighted the collaboration's role in advancing modern infrastructure.

title: Siemens Canada Expands Global Supply of Process Instrumentation from Peterborough Plant, Featuring Milltronics Technologies
summary: Siemens Canada is supplying its full range of process instrumentation, including legacy Milltronics weighing technologies like weigh feeders and belt scales, to the global market from its Peterborough, Ontario facility. The plant has overcome supply chain challenges through strategic inventory and local sourcing, enabling same-day fulfillment for some products. Siemens is also investing in sustainable practices to support the mining industry's transition to carbon neutrality.

title: Siemens Energy Announces $2.3 Billion Grid Manufacturing Investment
summary: Siemens Energy plans $2.3 billion investment in transformer and switchgear factories by 2028 to expand grid capacity amid rising electricity demand. Fiscal 2025 delivered strong profits and cash flow, enabling dividend restart and upgraded 2028 targets of 14-16% margins. CEO Christian Bruch highlighted sustainable growth and shareholder returns.

title: Siemens Plans Deconsolidation of Siemens Healthineers Stake
summary: Siemens announced plans to deconsolidate its 67% stake in Siemens Healthineers via a 30% spin-off to shareholders, sharpening focus on its core tech portfolio. CEO Roland Busch stated this unlocks value and accelerates growth in digital businesses and industrial AI. The move enhances capital flexibility while retaining minority participation.

title: Siemens Launches PAVE360 Automotive for Next-Gen Vehicle Development
summary: Siemens introduced PAVE360 Automotive, a digital twin platform integrating Arm Zena CSS to accelerate software-defined vehicle development for ADAS, automated driving, and infotainment. It enables early virtual integration, potentially shortening timelines by up to two years, with general availability in February 2026. The platform will be demonstrated at CES 2026.

title: Siemens Q4 2025 Earnings Miss Sends Stock Down 5-3%
summary: Siemens reported its Q4 2025 earnings, missing forecasts on EPS and revenue, leading to a stock decline. Despite the miss, the company maintains a positive outlook with 6-9% midterm revenue growth targeting digital industries and smart infrastructure expansions. Plans include deconsolidation of Siemens Healthineers and new AI products.

title: Energy Efficiency in Buildings Tops Organizations' Infrastructure Priorities: Siemens Study
summary: Siemens' Infrastructure Transition Monitor 2025 study reveals energy efficiency in buildings as the top infrastructure priority for organizations. The report, based on surveys of 1,400 executives, highlights progress in renewables and electrification but stagnation in building energy efficiency.

title: Siemens and Microsoft Enable Open-Standard IoT for Smart Buildings
summary: Siemens Smart Infrastructure is integrating its Building X platform with Microsoft Azure IoT Operations to simplify cloud connectivity for building data like HVAC systems and sensors. The solution enhances energy efficiency and sustainability for large facilities and will be available in the second half of 2025.

title: Siemens To Showcase Innovative And Sustainable Building Technology at ISH 2025
summary: Siemens Smart Infrastructure will present innovative building products and systems under the motto 'Technology to transform buildings' at ISH 2025 from March 17-21 in Frankfurt. Highlights include Building X with Generative AI, energy-efficient valves, and hybrid heating controls, focusing on digital transformation, energy efficiency, and cybersecurity.

title: Innovo and Siemens Announce Strategic Partnership in Building Technologies
summary: Innovo has signed a strategic partnership with Siemens, becoming a Siemens Solution Partner for Building Automation in the UAE to deliver and integrate the Building X portfolio. The agreement covers sales, integration, and support for modules like Lifecycle Twin, Energy Manager, and Comfort AI. This strengthens digital transformation and sustainability in the UAE's construction market.

title: Shaw & Co Continues Expansion with Appointment of New Director
summary: Shaw & Co announced the appointment of a new director on October 28, 2025, as part of its ongoing expansion efforts. This leadership addition aims to strengthen the firm's capabilities in corporate finance. The move signals continued growth in the financial services sector.

title: Shaw Industries Invents New Testing Methodology to Detect PFAS
summary: Shaw Industries publicly disclosed a new process on December 19, 2025, to help detect and remove PFAS from products. This innovation addresses growing concerns over these persistent chemicals in manufacturing. It positions the company as a leader in environmental compliance within the flooring industry.

title: Selis Successfully Hands Over 180t/24h Capacity Semolina Mill to Avrora Company in Azerbaijan
summary: Selis has successfully delivered a high-capacity 180t/24h semolina mill to Avrora Company, a leading player in Azerbaijan's pasta sector. This handover marks a significant project completion for Selis in the grain processing industry.

title: Sea-Doo Unveils 2025 Lineup with Renewed Focus on Sport Fishing and Luxury Models
summary: Sea-Doo introduced its 2025 model lineup, highlighting a re-dedication to sport fishing with the new Fish Pro Apex and a re-themed Switch tritoon, alongside the upgraded GTX Limited 325 featuring a 325-horsepower engine, new LinQ cleats, and dashboard. The lineup targets higher-end buyers amid shifting market behaviors in powersports. This bold strategy emphasizes premium features for fishing, luxury, and adventure segments.

title: BRP and Principal Shareholder Close Secondary Offering of Subordinate Voting Shares
summary: BRP Inc., the parent company of Sea-Doo, announced the closing of a previously announced bought deal secondary offering of Subordinate Voting Shares by Bain Capital Integral Investors II, L.P. on December 23, 2025. The offering was made via a prospectus supplement dated December 18, 2025. This financial transaction supports BRP's ongoing operations in powersports and marine products including Sea-Doo watercraft.

title: USDA Hogs and Pigs Report Shows Unexpected 1% Growth in U.S. Hog Inventory
summary: The December 2025 USDA report revealed a 1% year-over-year increase in U.S. hog inventory to 75.5 million, higher than expected. As a major pork producer, Seaboard faces potential profitability pressures from increased supply and falling lean hog futures values.

title: Corient Private Wealth LLC Buys 338 Shares of Seaboard Corporation
summary: Corient Private Wealth LLC purchased 338 shares of Seaboard Corporation (SEB) as reported on December 27, 2025. This institutional investment reflects ongoing interest from investors in the company's stock amid its recent financial performance.

title: Automated Flexible Conveyor Introduces Tiltable, Portable AFC SPIRALFEEDER® Flexible Screw Conveyor
summary: Automated Flexible Conveyor has launched a new tiltable AFC SPIRALFEEDER® flexible screw conveyor that allows a single operator to lower the unit at the push of a button for easy movement through doorways without tools or disassembly. Designed for food, chemical, pharmaceutical, and other facilities with tight spaces, it transfers powders, pellets, granules, and dry bulk solids efficiently. The product is manufactured in New Jersey with on-site testing available.

title: Cizzle Brands Corporation Closes Transformative Acquisition of Flow Water Inc.'s Co-Manufacturing Business
summary: Cizzle Brands Corporation announced the closing of its acquisition of Flow Water Inc.'s manufacturing operations on December 24, 2025, expected to generate pro forma revenue of $41 million in fiscal 2026 and $75 million in 2027. The deal accelerates Cizzle's path to profitability, secures in-house manufacturing for its brands, and creates operational synergies including cost reductions and improved production control. CEO John Celenza called it a pivotal moment positioning Cizzle as a leader in sustainable packaging.

title: Flow Brand Completes Strategic Separation of Manufacturing Operations to Cizzle Brands Corporation
summary: On December 24, 2025, Flow announced the separation of its brand and manufacturing operations, with Cizzle Brands Corporation acquiring the manufacturing business while Rucker Investments retains sole ownership of the Flow brand via Flow Canada LLC. This allows Flow to operate as a focused consumer brand with enhanced agility for North American expansion, supported by a diversified manufacturing network, with no jobs eliminated. Executives described the move as creating clarity, independence, and a stronger foundation for long-term success.

title: Satake USA Connected to Modern Recycling AI Advancements via Historical Acquisition
summary: An article on AI in recycling mentions a company that became part of Satake USA in Texas, noting its role in technological shifts. It discusses how AI enables recyclers to adapt to evolving packaging and sustainability demands without major equipment replacements. This ties Satake USA to ongoing industry innovations in recycling technology.

title: Darktrace Named Leader in 2025 Gartner Magic Quadrant for Email Security Platforms with Quote from Satake USA IT Manager
summary: Darktrace was named a Leader in the 2025 Gartner Magic Quadrant for Email Security Platforms. Stephen Shaw, IT Manager at Satake USA Inc., praised Darktrace / EMAIL for its precise targeting of cyber anomalies, intelligent email flow analysis, and removal of threats like phishing and spam. This highlights Satake USA's adoption of advanced cybersecurity solutions amid sophisticated email attacks.

title: Kice Industries and Sangati Berga Announce Strategic Alliance
summary: Kice Industries and Sangati Berga have signed a strategic alliance to combine resources for joint distribution, sales, and promotional efforts in grain milling projects across the US and Canada. The partnership leverages over 100 years of combined experience to deliver turn-key solutions and superior customer support. Executives from both companies expressed excitement about enhancing market offerings with innovative technology and high-quality equipment.

title: San Antonio Brewery Mad Pecker Closing Permanently After 2025 Reopening
summary: Mad Pecker Brewing in San Antonio is closing permanently despite reopening earlier in 2025. The closure marks the end of operations for the local craft beer business. No specific reasons were detailed in the report.

title: DOGE Cuts Federal Contracts Worth $3.6 Billion Impacting San Antonio Businesses
summary: DOGE eliminated federal contracts totaling at least $3.9 billion statewide, with $3.6 billion affecting San Antonio businesses, hitting the city harder than other Texas areas. This impacts local firms reliant on government work. The cuts represent significant financial losses.

title: Bexar County Businesses Affected by Layoffs in 2025
summary: Numerous Bexar County companies, including Christus Health Santa Rosa Hospital (479 layoffs), J & J Maintenance (279), and RAICES (159), issued layoff notices in 2025 under WARN data. Christus closed in April, with University Health acquiring the facility. Hundreds lost jobs across healthcare, maintenance, and services sectors.

title: San Antonio Small Businesses Navigate Tariffs While Positioning for 2026 Growth
summary: San Antonio small businesses face challenges from 2025 tariffs but are positioned for growth in 2026 due to population increases and diverse economy. Local firms are adapting amid trade pressures. The article highlights resilience in the business community.

title: Luxe San Antonio Mall Set for Expansion with New Stores in 2026
summary: The Shops at La Cantera mall in San Antonio plans expansion with new stores opening in 2026. Residents shared desired retailers in December 2025 discussions. This development aims to enhance the luxury shopping experience.

title: San Antonio Consumers Continued to Eke Out More Fall Spending in October
summary: San Antonio's city sales tax collections rose over 2% to $43 million in October 2025 compared to 2024, trailing larger Texas cities but indicating modest consumer spending growth. Year-to-date collections reached $458 million, up nearly 2%. Statewide sales tax increased over 5%, reflecting broad economic expansion.

title: Over 1,000 New Business Development Jobs Created in San Antonio, Texas
summary: ALM Intelligence announced the creation of over 1,000 new business development jobs in San Antonio on December 6, 2025, alongside enhancements to their VerdictSearch tool including improved case-specific research and user experience. The initiative boosts employment in the legal intelligence sector. Andrew Neblett, President of ALM Intelligence, emphasized the company's commitment to industry-leading products.

title: Perkins Coie Advises Safeguard on Its $230M IPO
summary: Perkins Coie advised Safeguard Acquisition Corp. on its successful $230 million IPO, selling 23 million units at $10 each on NYSE under SAC.U, including full over-allotment. The SPAC targets business combinations in aerospace, defense, government services, national security, and space sectors.

title: Safeguard Acquisition Corp. (SAC.U) Prices $200M IPO
summary: Safeguard Acquisition Corp. priced its $200 million IPO of 20 million units at $10 each, with an option for underwriters to purchase up to 3 million more units. Led by CEO Mark Gottfredson, COO Frank Bachinksy, CFO Robert M. Tarola, and a board including Dan Crowley and others, it focuses on mergers in aerospace, defense, government services, and space. Jefferies is the sole book-running manager; offering expected to close December 5, 2025.

title: Safeguard Acquisition Corp. Announces Closing of $230 Million Initial Public Offering Including Full Exercise of Underwriters’ Over-Allotment Option
summary: Safeguard Acquisition Corp. closed its IPO of 23 million units at $10 each, including full exercise of the 3 million unit over-allotment option, raising $230 million placed in trust. Concurrently, it completed a private placement of 700,000 units for $7 million with its sponsor and Jefferies. Units began trading on NYSE under SAC.U on December 4, 2025, targeting aerospace, defense, and space sectors.

title: Swissgrid Significantly Improves Sustainability Ratings
summary: ISS ESG upgraded Swissgrid's rating from B to B+, while Inrate confirmed its B+ rating. The improvements stem from enhanced sustainability efforts. This reflects positively on the company's environmental performance.

title: Daniel Brand Appointed as Head of Business Unit Grid Infrastructure on Swissgrid Executive Board
summary: The Swissgrid Board of Directors has appointed Daniel Brand (52) as Head of Business Unit Grid Infrastructure effective July 1, 2026, succeeding Adrian Häsler who is leaving the company. Brand brings extensive experience from BKW Power Grid where he has been Head of Grid Operations since 2018. CEO Yves Zumwald praised his expertise in grid infrastructure and operations.

title: Swisscom Partners with Planzer and LOXO for Highly Autonomous Delivery Vehicles
summary: Swisscom is providing connectivity expertise as a technology partner for Planzer and LOXO's pilot of an electric autonomous vehicle, 'Mathilde', for urban logistics from Bern's railway center. The project tests reliable mobile network and radio technologies for highly automated driving solutions. Swisscom's involvement highlights its role in advancing autonomous mobility through scalable connectivity.

title: Swisscom Expands Mobile Coverage to Flüela Pass Region
summary: Swisscom has launched a new mobile site on the Flüela Pass, significantly improving 4G and 5G coverage in a previously limited area through collaboration with local authorities and partners. The expansion is part of ongoing investments to provide outstanding network quality across Switzerland, regardless of geography. Philipp Bichsel, Head of Mobile Network, underscored the commitment to nationwide reliable connectivity.

title: Swisscom Confirms 3G Network Shutdown by End of 2025
summary: Swisscom will switch off its 3G network within weeks after December 31, 2025, to free up resources for faster 4G and 5G technologies, which are more efficient and support modern applications. Customers must upgrade to 4G/5G-compatible devices by 2026, with at least three years' notice planned for any future 4G phase-out. This move aligns with industry trends to modernize infrastructure.

title: Swisscom Q3 2025 Presentation: Revenue Dips but Guidance Maintained Amid Cost Savings
summary: Swisscom reported a revenue decline in Q3 2025 due to market headwinds but maintained its full-year guidance, highlighting network quality leadership and progress in AI services expansion. Integration of Italian operations with Fastweb and Vodafone Italia is on track, with synergies being captured and new offerings launched. CEO emphasized focus on AI consultancy and infrastructure services alongside cost transformation.

title: SWISCA moving forward with new headquarters in Herisau
summary: SWISCA AG is proceeding with construction of its new headquarters at Nordhalden in Herisau, Switzerland. This development supports the company's expansion in the milling technology sector. The project was reported on November 21, 2025.

title: SWISCA names Daniel Laubscher as new CEO to accelerate growth plans
summary: SWISCA AG has appointed Daniel Laubscher, a 46-year-old mechanical engineer, as its new CEO effective January 1, 2026, succeeding Heinz Brand. The appointment aims to drive the company's global expansion and growth initiatives. This leadership change was announced amid the company's accelerating growth plans.

title: STIF Anticipates Pro Forma Annual Revenue of €100 Million for FY 2025 Following H1 Revenue Jump
summary: STIF shares surged as H1 2025 revenue jumped 33%, prompting the company to raise its 2030 targets and anticipate pro forma annual revenue of around €100 million for fiscal year 2025. This outlook ties into recent acquisitions and growth in key markets like industrial safety and BESS.

title: STIF Group Completes Strategic Acquisition of 80% of BOSS PRODUCTS
summary: STIF Group acquired 80% of BOSS PRODUCTS in late 2025 via bank debt, projecting pro forma revenue of €100M by leveraging North America's industrial safety market growth. The deal integrates BOSS's U.S. distribution network and technical expertise, enhancing cross-border synergies and leadership in high-margin safety solutions. It also includes a majority stake in BOSS PRODUCTS UK, aligning with STIF's international expansion strategy.

title: Solix Group Acquires Majority Stake in Carsoe, Including SKIOLD in Portfolio
summary: Solix Group AB acquired 60% of Carsoe A/S, with management retaining 40%; Carsoe joins Solix portfolio alongside SKIOLD and other Danish industrial firms. Carsoe specializes in processing equipment for food, liquid, and seafood industries. This positions Carsoe for long-term development with Solix's investment approach.

title: New CEO Appointed at LANDMECO, Head of Poultry Unit in SKIOLD GROUP
summary: Anders Kristian Andersen appointed CEO of LANDMECO and head of the Poultry unit at SKIOLD GROUP effective November 15th, succeeding Henrik Helsinghof. Andersen joined LANDMECO in 2018 as Supply Chain Manager and has prior production management experience. The leadership change will not affect daily operations amid continued growth.

title: New Feed Factory in Vietnam Featuring SKIOLD Equipment
summary: SKIOLD delivered grinding solutions including two SK780 disc mills to Viet Thang Feed's new factory in Vietnam, capable of 500,000 tons annual pig feed production under the 'Dansk Feed' brand. The factory inauguration highlights Vietnam's growing agricultural market. SKIOLD participated in the opening ceremony.

title: New Head of Sales for EMEA at SKIOLD
summary: SKIOLD has appointed Martin Rindom as Head of Sales for EMEA, responsible for sales in feed production, grain and seed processing, and livestock housing systems. Martin brings over 25 years of experience in agriculture and industry, including recent role as Chief Commercial Officer at GreenFarm. This strengthens SKIOLD's focus on developing markets across EMEA.

title: Silo Pharma Raises $2.5 Million Through Registered Direct Stock Offering
summary: Silo Pharma closed a registered direct offering of 2,857,143 shares at $0.875 per share, raising approximately $2.5 million in gross proceeds before fees. Net proceeds will fund working capital and general corporate purposes.

title: Silo Pharma CEO Eric Weisblum Purchases Additional Shares on December 16, 2025
summary: Silo Pharma CEO Eric Weisblum bought 2,500 shares at $0.42 and 2,500 shares at $0.41 on December 16, 2025, signaling confidence in the company's future. This continues a pattern of insider buying by the CEO in recent months.

title: Silo Pharma Shareholders Approve Equity Plan Amendment and Reverse Stock Split Proposal
summary: Shareholders approved amendments to the equity plan and a reverse stock split, re-elected board directors including Eric Weisblum, and ratified the auditor for 2025. This supports Silo Pharma's strategic initiatives, including advancing SPC-15 for PTSD toward FDA IND submission by year-end. Positive safety study results were reported, with more data expected in early 2026.

title: Silexion Stock Falls After Receiving Positive German Regulatory Feedback on Phase 2/3 SIL204 Trial
summary: Silexion Therapeutics received formal written Scientific Advice from Germany's BfArM on its planned Phase 2/3 trial for SIL204, described as positive and covering study design, dosing, and manufacturing. Despite the milestone, the stock fell 4% due to the extended timeline, with Israeli submissions by end of Q4 2025 and German in Q1 2026. The company remains on track for trial initiation in H1 2026.

title: Silexion Therapeutics Announces Submission of Phase 2/3 Clinical Trial Application to Israel for SIL204 in Locally Advanced Pancreatic Cancer
summary: Silexion Therapeutics announced on December 16, 2025, the submission of its Phase 2/3 clinical trial application to the Israeli Ministry of Health for SIL204 targeting locally advanced pancreatic cancer. This follows positive feedback from Germany's BfArM and supports the company's plan to initiate the trial in the first half of 2026. The update highlights ongoing progress in regulatory preparations and operational readiness for trial launch.

title: Rogers Foods Launches December Newsletter with Holiday Recipes and Baking Contest
summary: Rogers Foods released its final 2025 newsletter featuring holiday recipes like Gingerbread Cinnamon Rolls and Iced Gingerbread Oatmeal Cookies, wellness tips on whole grain products, and a upcoming Holiday Baking Contest. It also highlights career opportunities at the company. The newsletter emphasizes seasonal baking and community engagement.

title: Tony Girdner Continues as President of Rogers Foods Ltd. Amid Miller Milling Leadership Change
summary: Tony Girdner remains president of Rogers Foods Ltd., a position held since 2017, following a leadership transition at sister company Miller Milling where a new CEO was appointed. Both companies are owned by Nisshin Seifun Group. Girdner brings over 30 years of experience in grain, milling, and logistics.

title: Rogers Sugar Reports Strong Profitability Growth in 2025
summary: Rogers Sugar announced strong fourth quarter and full-year 2025 results with higher adjusted EBITDA in both Sugar and Maple segments, driven by disciplined execution and customer focus. The company advanced its LEAP Project for capacity expansion and anticipates continued strong performance in 2026 despite market volatility from US tariffs. Domestic sales are expected to grow modestly while export volumes may decline.

title: Rockwell Automation Releases 2025 Sustainability Report
summary: On December 22, 2025, Rockwell Automation published its 2025 Sustainability Report, emphasizing commitment to resilience, agility, and sustainability. The report covers efforts in sustainable customers, company operations, and communities. It reflects ongoing ESG priorities.

title: Rockwell Automation Recognized in Various 2025 Gartner Hype Cycle Reports
summary: Rockwell Automation was cited in multiple 2025 Gartner Hype Cycle reports across industrial technologies. This recognition underscores their leadership in automation and digital transformation. Gartner notes do not constitute endorsements but reflect analyst opinions.

title: Rockwell Automation Showcases Solutions and Launches ControlLogix 5590 at Industrial Transformation Saudi Arabia 2025
summary: At the Industrial Transformation Saudi Arabia event (Dec 1-3, 2025), Rockwell demonstrated the Plex Smart Manufacturing Platform and launched the ControlLogix 5590 controller for autonomous operations. The showcases align with Saudi Vision 2030 for enhanced productivity. Live demos highlighted MES, QMS, and cloud-native capabilities.

title: Rockwell Automation Extends Presence in Saudi Arabia with Alfanar Group Partnership
summary: Rockwell Automation announced a collaboration with Saudi firm Alfanar Group to expand its business in Saudi Arabia. This partnership supports regional growth in industrial automation. It aligns with efforts to strengthen Middle East operations.

title: Rockwell Automation Increases Quarterly Dividend to $1.38
summary: Rockwell Automation raised its quarterly dividend to $1.38 per share, paid on December 10, up from $1.31 previously, signaling financial confidence. This follows strong Q3 results with $3.34 EPS beating estimates and $4.63B revenue. Analysts have raised price targets in response.

title: Rockwell Automation Reports Fourth Quarter and Full Year 2025 Results and Introduces Fiscal 2026 Guidance
summary: Rockwell Automation announced its fiscal 2025 Q4 and full-year results, along with FY2026 guidance. The company reported strong performance as a global leader in industrial automation. This financial update highlights their ongoing growth and future outlook.

title: Riviana Foods and California Association of Food Banks Team Up to Fight Hunger with Second Annual 'Jars of Hope' Initiative
summary: Riviana Foods Inc., through its RiceSelect® brand, is partnering with the California Association of Food Banks for the second annual 'Jars of Hope' initiative to combat food insecurity in California, where 5.4 million people, including 1.4 million children, face hunger. The company is donating shelf-stable rice products, which are typically underrepresented in food bank donations, especially during the holidays. RiceSelect Brand Manager Megan Byerly highlighted the pride in making a community difference with this ongoing partnership.

title: Richardson International Acquires European Oat Millers Ltd.
summary: Richardson International closed its acquisition of UK-based European Oat Millers Ltd. (EOM) on December 22, 2025, expanding its oat processing capabilities in Europe. The deal positions Richardson as a larger player in the European oat milling market.

title: Richardson International Completes Acquisition of 8th Avenue Pasta Business
summary: Richardson International finalized its $375 million acquisition of the pasta division from Post Holdings, including three production facilities and the Ronzoni brand, strengthening its US operations in pasta production. The deal, initially announced in August 2025, closed on December 1, 2025, after regulatory approvals, integrating about 500 employees. This move extends Richardson's durum wheat expertise into branded consumer goods.

title: Richardson International Expands Pasta Investment with $375M Purchase
summary: Winnipeg-based Richardson International closed a deal to acquire the 8th Avenue pasta business from Post Holdings for US$375 million, adding facilities in Carrington, North Dakota, and New Hope, Minnesota. The acquisition enhances Richardson's production capabilities in the pasta sector. It includes the Ronzoni retail pasta brand and integrates 500 employees into the company.

title: Richardson International Completes Acquisition of 8th Avenue Pasta Business
summary: Richardson International Limited successfully closed its acquisition of the pasta business from 8th Avenue Food & Provisions, Inc., including a durum mill and three U.S. pasta plants in Carrington, ND; New Hope, MN; and Winchester, VA, valued at approximately US$375 million. This move strengthens Richardson's vertically integrated supply chain from wheat sourcing to pasta production and expands its U.S. operations across retail, private label, foodservice, and ingredient channels. CEO Darwin Sobkow highlighted it as a key step in the company's growth strategy, welcoming about 500 new employees.

title: Regal Rexnord Announces Quarterly Dividend of $0.35 Per Share
summary: Regal Rexnord declared a quarterly dividend of $0.35 per share, payable January 14 to shareholders of record on December 31, yielding 1.0% annualized. The dividend payout ratio stands at 36.18%.

title: Harbor Capital Advisors Holds $1.27 Million Stake in Regal Rexnord; CEO Sells Shares
summary: Harbor Capital Advisors maintained a $1.27 million position in Regal Rexnord as of recent filing. CEO Louis V. Pinkham sold 35,935 shares for $5.25 million on November 25, reducing his ownership by 25.82%. Analysts show mixed but overall positive ratings with a Moderate Buy consensus.

title: Regal Rexnord Q3 2025 Results Show Weak Organic Growth and Revised Lower Guidance, Labeled High-Risk Bet
summary: Regal Rexnord reported 0.7% organic revenue growth and adjusted EPS of $2.51 missing expectations, with revised 2025 guidance down to $9.50–$9.80. Free cash flow prioritized debt repayment over reinvestment, contrasting with peers, amid concerns over margins and one-off project reliance. Analysts highlight underperformance in industrial sectors despite data center demand.

title: Regal Shop Launches Limited-Edition SpongeAvatar Popcorn Bucket & Tumbler Combos
summary: Regal Shop introduced limited-edition SpongeAvatar popcorn bucket and tumbler combos, tying into popular film releases. This new merchandise offering aims to enhance the moviegoing experience with themed products.

title: Regal Celebrates Exceptional 10-Day Performance with 1.1 Million Unique Guests
summary: Regal welcomed 1.1 million unique and new guests over a 10-day holiday stretch, fueled by franchise event films, marking one of the strongest attendance surges of the year. This reinforces the renewed strength of the theatrical experience amid the holiday movie season.

title: Avatar: Fire and Ash Anchors Strong December Weekend for Regal with Elevated Attendance and Sales
summary: Regal theatres reported strong weekend performance driven by Avatar: Fire and Ash, alongside new releases like The Housemaid and The SpongeBob Movie, boosting attendance, food & beverage spend, and merchandise sales. Premium formats and upgraded locations contributed to top-performing theatres nationwide. The success highlights sustained demand for in-theatre entertainment during the holiday period.

title: Germany's PCK Refinery Assures No Material Impact from Pipeline Oil Spill
summary: Germany’s PCK refinery, partially owned by Russia’s Rosneft, stated that a pipeline oil spill will not materially affect production. Sabotage is suspected, amid recent issues at other Russian-affiliated European refineries. The incident highlights ongoing disruptions in the sector.

title: U.S. Oil Refiners to Shut In 145,000 bpd Capacity Week Ending December 26
summary: IIR Energy reports U.S. refiners expected to shut in 145,000 bpd of capacity in the week ending December 26, paradoxically increasing available capacity by 41,000 bpd. Additional issues include Pemex work at Deer Park refinery and Shell process interruption at Corunna site. This occurs amid broader oil market trends affecting refining.

title: Eneos Leads Bids for Chevron's 50% Stake in Singapore Refinery
summary: Japan's Eneos Holdings is ahead of competitors like Glencore and Vitol in bidding for Chevron's 50% stake in Singapore Refining Company. The deal is nearing conclusion, marking another divestment by a global oil major in Singapore's key refining hub. This reflects opportunities for firms to capture margins in Asia Pacific's growing demand region.

title: Tema Oil Refinery Resumes Crude Refining After Years of Shutdown
summary: Ghana's Tema Oil Refinery (TOR) has restarted crude oil refining operations following major Turnaround Maintenance on its Crude Distillation Unit, completed between August and October. The National Petroleum Authority granted clearance after inspections, with operations proceeding in a phased approach for stabilization. TOR plans to restore capacity to 45,000 bpd and expand to 60,000 bpd medium-term, aiming to supply 60% of domestic fuel demand and save USD 400 million monthly on imports.

title: Red River Bank and Federal Home Loan Bank of Dallas Celebrate $12M in Grants
summary: On December 10, 2025, Red River Bank and the Federal Home Loan Bank of Dallas marked 25 years of partnership by celebrating $12 million in grants supporting affordable housing, disaster recovery, and economic development in Louisiana communities.

title: Red River Bancshares, Inc. Increases and Renews Stock Repurchase Program for 2026
summary: On December 18, 2025, Red River Bancshares announced the renewal and increase of its stock repurchase program, authorizing up to $10 million in purchases of its common stock from January 1 to December 31, 2026. The board-approved initiative aims to enhance shareholder value and signals confidence in the company's financial health amid Q3 2025 revenue growth of 14.47% year-over-year.

title: Red River Acquires Invictus to Strengthen Cyber and Enterprise Modernization Capabilities
summary: Red River, a technology transformation company, announced the acquisition of Invictus, a mission-focused national security services provider, on December 3, 2025. Invictus will operate as 'Invictus, a Red River Company,' enhancing Red River's capabilities in AI-driven cybersecurity, IT modernization, and support for Department of War, Intelligence Community, and federal agencies. The deal preserves Invictus' leadership and expands access to Red River's resources and supply chain.

title: Rabobank International London Post-Stabilisation Notice: No Stabilisation Undertaken for Achmea Bank N.V.
summary: Rabobank International London issued a post-stabilisation notice confirming that no stabilisation activities were conducted for Achmea Bank N.V.'s EUR 500 million issuance. This is a routine regulatory filing. The announcement underscores compliance with market stabilisation protocols.

title: Rabobank International London Issues Post-Stabilisation Period Announcement
summary: Rabobank International London released a post-stabilisation period announcement on December 24, 2025. The notice indicates standard regulatory disclosure following a stabilisation period. It was marked as not for direct distribution.

title: DRS by REPCO NEX Under SCGC Wins 2 Global Awards
summary: REPCO NEX, under SCGC, received two global awards for its DRS at the Huawei Global Installer Summit on December 22, 2025. This recognition highlights achievements in their operations. It underscores REPCO NEX's innovation in the sector.

title: REPCo Acquires All Shares in Oiltech
summary: REPCo, a Milan-based joint venture between Cavagna Group and Nirmal Industrial Controls, has acquired all shares in Oiltech, a Milan-based firm specializing in process engineering for EPC and energy sectors. The acquisition strengthens REPCo's supply chain presence and expertise in oil, gas, and energy solutions. Executives from both companies highlighted it as a key step in expanding end-to-end services.

title: PepsiCo Announces Priorities to Enhance Shareholder Value with Innovation and Cost Cuts
summary: PepsiCo highlights innovation, productivity, and affordability initiatives at PepsiCo Foods North America to boost growth and margins. Plans include optimizing North American supply chain, cutting product lineup by 20%, removing artificial ingredients, and workforce reductions following talks with Elliott Investment Management. Expects accelerated organic revenue and EPS growth in 2026.

title: PepsiCo Remakes Lay's Packaging and Snack Strategy Amid Sales Pressure
summary: PepsiCo Foods North America, including Frito-Lay and Quaker, introduces new Lay's packaging with farm-to-bag graphics, real potatoes emphasis, and new oils like olive and avocado. All core Lay's products will be free of artificial flavors/colors by end of 2025, responding to clean-label trends and declining sales. Efforts include cost-cutting, plant closures, and SKU reductions.

title: PepsiCo Announces Organizational Changes to Accelerate Growth
summary: Steven Williams, former CEO of PepsiCo North America, appointed Executive Vice President and Vice Chairman, Global Chief Commercial Officer effective December 28, 2025. Ram Krishnan will succeed as CEO of PepsiCo North America, focusing on integrating Foods and Beverages operations. Additional leadership updates include Rachel Ferdinando remaining CEO of US Foods Category and promotions for Mike Del Pozzo and others.

title: Quaker Oats Recalls Cap'n Crunch Peanut Butter Crunch Cereal Due to Potential Salmonella Presence
summary: Quaker Oats initiated a voluntary recall of 21 boxes of Cap'n Crunch's Peanut Butter Crunch cereal distributed to five Target stores after routine sampling detected potential Salmonella contamination. The affected products have specific best-before dates and were purchased after November 5. No illnesses have been confirmed, and consumers are advised to discard or return the product.

title: Quaker Oats Recalls 10,000 Boxes of Pearl Milling Company Pancake Mix for Milk Allergy Risk
summary: The Quaker Oats Company, a PepsiCo unit, recalled approximately 10,000 2-pound boxes of Pearl Milling Company Original Pancake & Waffle Mix due to undeclared milk, posing a risk of allergic reactions. The product was sold in stores across 11 states with a best-by date of September 13, 2025, and purchases possible as early as November 2024. No related allergic reactions have been reported.

title: Proterra Emerges from Chapter 11 Bankruptcy with New Ownership and Debt-Free Balance Sheet
summary: Proterra Inc. successfully emerged from Chapter 11 bankruptcy after court approval of its reorganization plan, deleveraging its balance sheet by repaying and equitizing $200 million in funded debt. The company sold its Proterra Powered battery business for $210 million and Proterra Transit bus manufacturing for $10 million, retaining Proterra Energy with substantial cash reserves and no funded debt obligations. Equity is now distributed to second lien convertible noteholders, providing meaningful recovery to unsecured claims.

title: Prince Rupert Gateway Partners Celebrate Sustainability Milestone with EcoDiesel
summary: PRPA and 13 partners reduced GHG emissions by replacing over two million litres of diesel with Petro-Canada EcoDiesel in 2025, displacing 24% of annual conventional diesel use. Collaborations with Suncor and Jepson Petroleum ensured supply across terminals and service providers. This advances PRPA's goals of 30% carbon intensity reduction by 2030 and carbon neutrality by 2050.

title: PRPA Announces New Interim President Kurt Slocombe
summary: The Prince Rupert Port Authority (PRPA) appointed Kurt Slocombe as interim president effective January 1, 2026, following Shaun Stevenson's retirement on December 31, 2025. Slocombe joined PRPA in 2019 as vice-president of operations, planning, and infrastructure, with extensive experience in gateway operations since 2007. The Board is conducting a search for a permanent President and CEO.

title: Port of Vancouver Featured in Presentation on Procurement Compliance for Washington Ports
summary: Dawn Egbert from the Port of Vancouver presented alongside legal experts at the WPPA annual meeting on port procurement laws, emphasizing public bidding, notifications for professional services, and policies for minority-owned firms. The article provides tips on adopting procurement policies, delegation of authority, and ensuring statutory compliance to protect public funds.[4]

title: Port of Vancouver USA Releases 2025 State of the Port Report Highlighting Record 2024 Financial Performance
summary: The Port of Vancouver USA issued its 2025 State of the Port Report video on April 10, 2025, detailing 2024 as one of its strongest financial years, supporting nearly 20,000 jobs and generating $2.9 billion in economic benefits. Port CEO Julianna Marler credited diversification strategies and team efforts, with highlights including Terminal 1 development and diverse cargo handling.[2]

title: Alternative Ship Fuels Gain Traction in Washington Ports Including Vancouver
summary: Washington ports, including the Port of Vancouver, are adopting alternative ship fuels to reduce greenhouse gas emissions from the shipping industry, a major environmental polluter. The development highlights ongoing industry efforts to transition to cleaner energy sources amid climate pressures.[6]

title: Port of Vancouver USA Announces Holiday Closure Schedule for Cargo Operations and Administration
summary: The Port of Vancouver USA will close for cargo receipt and delivery on December 24, 25, 31, 2025, and January 1, 2026, in observance of Christmas and New Year's holidays. The administration office will also be closed on December 25, 2025, and January 1, 2026. Additionally, the port administrative office is closed for renovations, with updates on commission meetings and public tours available.[1]

title: Feds Greenlight Ship Turnarounds Near Longview and Kalama Ports
summary: Federal authorities have approved ship turnaround maneuvers near the Port of Longview and Kalama ports, a longtime priority. The project still requires Congressional approval and funding to proceed. It aims to improve navigational efficiency in the region.

title: Port of Longview Agrees on Next CEO
summary: The Port of Longview has selected its next CEO, marking a key leadership transition. Details on the appointee and start date were announced around December 23, 2025. This update ensures continuity in port operations and development efforts.

title: Canada Urges Nutrien to Abandon $500M+ Longview Fertilizer Terminal
summary: Canadian officials are pressuring Nutrien to drop its planned $500 million-plus fertilizer terminal at the Port of Longview. Port Commissioner Allan Erickson remains enthusiastic, aiming to finalize a lease in early 2026. The development highlights ongoing international interest despite external opposition.

title: Nutrien Identifies Port of Longview as Preferred Site for Massive Potash Export Terminal
summary: Giant Canadian fertilizer company Nutrien has selected the Port of Longview as its preferred location for a $500 million to $1 billion potash export terminal, potentially the largest project in port history. The project would diversify exports beyond volatile grain markets but faces unresolved issues like lease agreements, environmental reviews, and labor concerns. Local leaders express optimism for economic benefits including tax reductions and job creation.

title: Energy Transfer Suspends Lake Charles LNG Export Project Amid High Costs
summary: Energy Transfer has shelved its 16.5 million ton per year Lake Charles LNG terminal due to a high-cost environment and superior risk/return profiles elsewhere. The project, which faced delays for over a decade including regulatory hurdles, had recently completed marketing efforts but will now prioritize gas pipelines. This reflects broader cost pressures squeezing US Gulf Coast LNG developers.

title: USCG Sector Houston Changes COC Exam Request Policy
summary: Effective December 22, 2025, USCG Sector Houston will no longer accept Certificate of Compliance exam requests more than 10 calendar days in advance, impacting port operations scheduling.[5]

title: Port Houston November Volumes Dip but Year-to-Date Tonnage Up 4% and TEUs Up 5%
summary: Port Houston handled 4.18 million short tons in November (down 15% YoY) and 335,275 TEUs (down 9% YoY), but year-to-date totals are up 4% in tonnage (50.38 million tons) and 5% in TEUs (3.97 million), on track for record container year driven by exports.[1][2][4]

title: Port Houston Renews Central and South America Regional Representative Contract
summary: The Commission renewed the two-year contract (with one-year option) for Port Houston's Central and South America representative, representing 28% of Houston Ship Channel's market and 18% of public terminal volume. Similar representations exist for Europe and Asia.[1][3]

title: Port Houston Accepts $7.7 Million TxDOT Grant for Bayport Roadway Construction
summary: The Commission authorized acceptance of $7.7 million in grant funds for constructing a critical roadway providing additional access to the growing Bayport Container Terminal. This supports expanded capacity and future growth at public terminals.[1][3]

title: Port Houston Commission Approves Key Initiatives Including New Cranes and $7.7M Grant
summary: On December 9, 2025, the Port Commission approved initiatives to strengthen trade, modernize operations, and expand infrastructure, including five new rubber-tire gantry cranes arriving at Bayport in December and 11 more in early 2026 to boost container capacity. They also accepted $7.7 million in Seaport Connectivity Program grant funds from TxDOT for a new roadway to Bayport Container Terminal and renewed the Central and South America regional representative contract. Completed projects include Bayport Wharf 7 and Exit Gate to improve efficiency.[1][3]
