summary: Harvest declared a monthly cash distribution of $0.1031 per Class A share (PRM:TSX) and a quarterly distribution of $0.1250 per Preferred share (PRM.PR.A:TSX) for Big Pharma Split Corp., both payable January 6, 2026 to shareholders of record on December 31, 2025. This continues Harvest's routine distribution announcements for its investment products.

title: Harvest ETFs Announces December 2025 Distributions
summary: Harvest Portfolios Group Inc. announced monthly distributions for various Harvest ETFs, including HIND ($0.0700 per unit), HVOI ($0.0800 per unit), HBIX ($0.2400 per unit), and HBTE ($0.4300 per unit), payable on or about January 6, 2026. A quarterly distribution of $0.0900 per unit was also declared for HVOL. These distributions have an ex-dividend date of December 31, 2025.

title: Harris Receives 2026 Top Workplaces Frontline Workers Award
summary: Harris, a leading national mechanical contractor, has been recognized with the 2026 Top Workplaces Frontline Workers Award. The award honors organizations for excellence in supporting frontline workers. This accolade highlights Harris's strong workplace culture.[3]

title: Direct Digital Control Becomes 'a Harris Company' Through Partnership
summary: On December 1st, 2025, South Dakota-based HVAC Building Automation provider Direct Digital Control will become 'a Harris Company' via a partnership with Harris, headquartered in Saint Paul, Minnesota. Direct Digital Control, operational since 1994, specializes in designing, customizing, and managing facility management systems and has a branch office beyond its Sioux Falls headquarters. This move expands Harris's capabilities in the HVAC and building automation sector.[1][3]

company_name: Harinera de Silao S.A. de C.V.
title: Agricultores mantienen bloqueo de más de 34 horas en planta harinera de Maseca en Silao
summary: Agricultores en Silao cumplieron más de 34 horas bloqueando la planta de Maseca, impidiendo el paso de camiones mientras esperan una reunión para negociar el precio del maíz. El grupo, de poco más de 20 productores, se resguarda del frío frente a la planta en la carretera federal 45. Confían en lograr un acuerdo similar al de Bachoco con el sorgo.

company_name: Harinera de Silao S.A. de C.V.
title: Productores liberan bloqueo en planta de Maseca en Silao tras acuerdo preliminar
summary: Productores del campo levantaron el bloqueo parcial en la planta de Maseca en Silao, Guanajuato, después de más de 34 horas, permitiendo la liberación de transportistas varados. El acuerdo preliminar se alcanzó en una reunión en Irapuato con directivos del sector agroalimentario, incluyendo Maseca, para negociar un precio justo por el maíz. Las negociaciones continuarán para un acuerdo definitivo.

title: HP Accelerates Future of Work with 14 New Innovations Including AI Stations and Ergonomic Devices
summary: HP announced 14 new products enhancing workspaces, AI workflows, and printing, such as the HP Tilt Ergonomic Mouse 725M ($69.99, December 2025), HP ZGX Nano G1n AI Station (fall 2025), and Multi-Device Mouse/Keyboard Combo ($74.99, December 2025). Updates to Workforce Experience Platform and AI print/scan features are also rolling out through 2026.

title: HP Announces Fiscal 2026 Plan to Cut 4,000-6,000 Jobs by 2028 for AI Transformation
summary: HP plans to reduce global headcount by 4,000 to 6,000 employees by fiscal 2028 as part of an AI adoption initiative targeting $1 billion in gross run-rate savings. The restructuring will incur about $650 million in costs, including $250 million in fiscal 2026. Leaders emphasize it strengthens competitiveness amid cost pressures.

title: HP Inc. Reports Fiscal 2025 Full Year and Fourth Quarter Results with Dividend Declaration
summary: HP Inc. announced fiscal 2025 full-year revenue of $55.3 billion, up 3.2% year-over-year, and non-GAAP diluted net EPS of $3.12. The board declared a quarterly cash dividend of $0.30 per share, payable January 2, 2026. The company highlighted strong execution and AI-driven growth in PCs.

title: AGI Provides Bi-Weekly Status Report on Management Cease Trade Order
summary: AGI issued its latest bi-weekly update on the Management Cease Trade Order (MCTO) granted on November 14, 2025, due to delays in filing Q3 2025 financial statements and MD&A, originally due November 14. No material changes reported since the December 12 update, with efforts ongoing to complete filings. This reflects ongoing compliance challenges.

title: AGI Announces Q4 2025 Dividend of $0.15 per Share
summary: AGI declared a cash dividend of $0.15 per common share for Q4 2025, payable on January 12, 2026, to shareholders of record on December 31, 2025. This maintains the annualized dividend rate at $0.60 per share and underscores financial stability. The announcement was made on December 17, 2025.

title: AGI Launches New FX4 Conveyors for Efficient Grain Handling
summary: Ag Growth International Inc. (AGI) launched two new high-capacity conveyors: the FX4 SP (gas over hydraulic drive) and FX4 18S (electric top-drive), designed for superior grain movement efficiency. These conveyors offer increased capacity up to 10,500 BPH, enhanced durability, and simplified setup features like improved hoppers and drive rollers. Available under AGI brands including Hi-Roller.

title: Building Products Inc. Acquires Heartland Millwork
summary: Building Products Inc. (BPI) has acquired Heartland Millwork, a custom millwork manufacturer based in Larchwood, Iowa, effective immediately. The acquisition enhances BPI's millwork offerings, expands market reach, and improves operational efficiency through volume purchasing and new equipment investments. Shane Roth, Heartland Millwork's general manager of operations, expressed excitement about joining BPI to offer wider product options.

title: Harinas del Istmo S.A. Lidera Importaciones de Trigo en Panamá en Junio 2025
summary: Harinas del Istmo S.A. se destaca como uno de los principales importadores de trigo y meslin (HS 100119) en Panamá durante junio 2025, con importaciones totales del país cayendo 4.82% a $1.23 mil millones. El trigo creció 92.11% a $9.79 millones, reflejando demanda en el sector panadero.

title: Tribunal Superior Ratifica Condena a Harineras del Istmo por Prácticas Monopolísticas
summary: El Tribunal Superior de Panamá confirmó la condena contra Harinas del Istmo, S.A. y otras harineras por colusión en la fijación ilegal de precios de harina de trigo, afectando a panaderías y el precio del pan en el país. Cada empresa podría enfrentar multas de hasta 100 mil dólares. Esta es la primera sentencia firme bajo la Ley 29 de 1996 sobre libre competencia.

company_name: Grupo Empresarial de la Industria Alimentaria (GEIA) (MINAL/ICBAL)
title: Grupo Empresarial de la Industria Alimentaria Analyzes Government Program and Proposes Reforms
summary: On December 4, 2025, the GEIA held a Council of Direction meeting to review the updated Government Program for correcting distortions and boosting the economy. President Emerio González Lorenzo highlighted execution shortfalls due to lacks in electricity, raw materials, and fuel, impacting over 80% of production for the domestic market. Proposals included foreign currency bank accounts for procurement and increased exports of production services.

title: Greenway Technologies Announces Board Appointments Effective November 21, 2025
summary: Greenway Technologies expanded its Board from five to seven members, appointing Douglas Cogan, with extensive energy and technology experience, and C. Dunham Biles, a litigation expert, effective November 21, 2025. Both will serve until the next annual shareholder meeting. The appointments strengthen leadership in engineering, technology, and legal matters.

title: Greenway Technologies Announces Term Sheet with Swift Creek, LLC
summary: Greenway Technologies signed a non-binding term sheet on December 5, 2025, with Swift Creek, LLC for the purchase of a G-Reformer™ and Fischer Tropsch micro-plant capable of producing at least five barrels per day of liquid hydrocarbons, priced at $16 million, with Greenway retaining 20% offtake. Swift Creek will also promote and market Greenway's systems for commissions. This marks a key step toward commercialization of Greenway's gas-to-liquids and gas-to-hydrogen technologies.

title: Les Grand Moulins des Antilles (GMA) placés en procédure de sauvegarde
summary: Le groupe GMA a été placé en procédure de sauvegarde par le Tribunal mixte de commerce de Pointe-à-Pitre. Le groupe dispose de douze mois pour restructurer ses finances. Cette mesure vise à protéger l'entreprise face à des difficultés financières.

title: GoldRiver Orchards Announces Upcoming Launch of Walnut Bitter Product for Cocktails and Cooking
summary: GoldRiver Orchards, a fifth-generation walnut grower, is preparing to launch a walnut bitter on Amazon in the first quarter as its first retail direct-to-consumer product. The innovation aims to highlight walnut flavor and quality, moving beyond commodity sales toward an ingredient and consumer-focused business. The company is also advancing sustainability through a joint venture converting walnut shells into biochar.[7]

title: Gold River Production Acquires 100% Stake of US Shrimp Genetics Supplier Trans American Aquaculture
summary: Gold River Production, Inc. has acquired Texas-based Trans American Aquaculture (TAA), a supplier of shrimp genetics and producer of pacific white shrimp. The acquisition shifts the company's main business to aquaculture production and genetics, leveraging TAA's proprietary cold-water tolerant and disease-resistant shrimp lines. Over USD 9 million has been committed to the Rio Hondo facility, with strong international interest in their US-borne genetics.[3]

title: GMach Completes 500 Ton/Day Wheat Processing Milling System in Iraq
summary: GMach has completed a high-capacity turnkey flour mill project in a multi-storey building in Iraq with a daily wheat processing capacity of 500 tons. The project was executed meticulously, continuing the company's successful operations in the Middle East.

title: GMach Milling Commissions 350 Tons/Day Flour Mill in Kazakhstan's Karaganda Region
summary: GMach Milling has successfully commissioned a new flour mill project in Karaganda, Kazakhstan, featuring a steel-structured design with a daily grinding capacity of 350 tons. This project highlights the company's 35 years of experience and over 370 turnkey flour and semolina production facilities worldwide. The expansion strengthens GMach's presence in the region.

title: Ruth Noah Giusto et al. vs. Giusto's Specialty Foods LLC - Court Compliance Hearing Scheduled for December 9, 2025
summary: A legal case involving Ruth Noah Giusto and others against Giusto's Specialty Foods LLC includes a compliance hearing set for December 9, 2025, following service of documents on December 4, 2025. An affidavit of service was sent on that date, with prior activity noted on November 26, 2025. This appears to be an ongoing regulatory or compliance matter directly involving the company.

title: Assenagon Asset Management Sells General Mills Shares; Insider Paul Joseph Gallagher Sells 1,500 Shares
summary: Assenagon Asset Management reduced its General Mills holdings, and insider Paul Joseph Gallagher sold 1,500 shares on December 19, 2025. This follows the company's Q2 earnings beat but occurs amid revenue declines and FY2026 guidance. Analysts maintain a 'hold' rating on the stock.

title: General Mills Beats Q2 Earnings Expectations Despite Yogurt Divestiture Challenges
summary: General Mills reported Q2 adjusted EPS of $1.10, surpassing Wall Street's $1.02 estimate, with net sales of $4.9 billion topping forecasts despite a 7% decline due to yogurt sales drop. CEO Jeff Harmening highlighted investments in innovation and omnichannel execution driving volume growth. The company anticipates a transitional fiscal 2026 with modest organic sales outlook.

title: General Mills Enters Agreements to Sell North American Yogurt Businesses for Approximately $2 Billion
summary: General Mills signed definitive agreements to divest its North American yogurt businesses, including Yoplait, to Lactalis and Sodiaal for about $2 billion, with closure expected in calendar 2025 pending approvals. This strategic move shifts focus to higher-margin categories amid challenges in fresh dairy. The divestiture impacted Q2 sales but is viewed as positioning for long-term growth.

title: General Mills Reports Fiscal 2026 Second-Quarter Results and Reaffirms Full-Year Outlook
summary: General Mills announced Q2 fiscal 2026 results on December 17, 2025, with net sales of approximately $4.86 billion, down 7% year-over-year but beating analyst expectations, and adjusted EPS of $1.10 exceeding forecasts. The company reaffirmed its full-year outlook amid a transitional period following yogurt divestitures, emphasizing investments in growth. Shares rose post-announcement despite sales decline.

title: Great Western Manufacturing (KS) and Gazel Makina (Turkey) Form Strategic Sales Alliance
summary: Great Western Manufacturing from Kansas and Gazel Makina from Turkey have announced a strategic sales alliance to enhance their market presence in the milling industry. This partnership aims to leverage combined strengths in manufacturing and sales for flour milling equipment. The alliance was highlighted in recent milling industry news.

title: Trane Technologies Declares Dividend Payable December 31, 2025, Referencing Gardner Denver Holdings
summary: Trane Technologies announced a dividend payable on December 31, 2025, to shareholders of record on December 5, 2025, in investor updates that reference Gardner Denver Holdings, Inc. (NYSE: GDI). This follows historical context of Trane's industrial business spin-off combining with Gardner Denver.

title: Gardner Denver Acquires DV Systems
summary: Gardner Denver Holdings Inc. announced the acquisition of DV Systems Inc., a leading Canadian manufacturer of rotary screw and piston compressors and aftermarket parts, funded with cash on hand. DV Systems will integrate into Gardner Denver’s Industrials Segment, aligning with their strategy for profitable growth in mission-critical technologies. CEOs from both companies expressed excitement about expanded markets and product portfolios.

title: GVS S.p.A. Completes €10.4 Million Share Buyback Program
summary: GVS S.p.A. has concluded its €10.4 million share buyback program as announced on December 19, 2025. This marks the end of the repurchase initiative authorized earlier in the year.

title: GVS S.p.A. Buys Back Nearly €250,000 Worth of Shares (December 1-5, 2025)
summary: GVS S.p.A. repurchased 64,623 ordinary shares between December 1 and 5, 2025, at a weighted average price of €3.8867, for a total value of €249,878.97. The company now holds nearly 2.4 million shares, representing 1.3% of its share capital.

title: GVS S.p.A. Announces Share Buyback Transactions for December 8-12, 2025
summary: GVS S.p.A. reported purchases of approximately 12,968 to 13,166 shares daily during the week of December 8-12, 2025, at weighted average prices around €3.80-€3.86, totaling nearly €50,000 per day. This is part of the share buyback program authorized in May 2025 and launched in June. Detailed transaction logs confirm multiple trades on the XMIL market.

title: GSI Technology to Showcase APU Advancements at 28th Annual Needham Growth Conference
summary: GSI Technology's executive team will participate virtually in the Needham Growth Conference on January 15, 2026, to highlight its Associative Processing Unit (APU) and compute-in-memory innovations for AI edge computing. The event follows a 24.92% stock surge during December 22-26, 2025, driven by attention on the APU and recent funding. It aims to boost investor engagement amid growing social media buzz on AI hardware developments.[1][2][3]

title: GSI Technology Secures $50 Million in Funding to Accelerate APU Development and Edge AI Initiatives
summary: GSI Technology recently raised $50 million in financing to speed up development of its Gemini-II APU and next-generation edge large language model deployment, targeting the $9.6 billion edge AI market by 2030. This funding follows validation from Cornell University demonstrating energy-efficient performance comparable to NVIDIA GPUs in AI tasks. The capital strengthens the company's balance sheet and supports its pivot to AI compute-in-memory technology.[1][3]

title: GSI Technology Stock Surge and Social Media Buzz on AI Hardware Developments
summary: Social media discussions on December 26, 2025, highlight excitement around GSI Technology's Gemini APU for AI inference and vector search, with stock jumping over 13% in premarket. Users note the recent $50 million cash raise as a de-risking move and anticipate visibility from a January Needham Growth Conference presentation. Institutional investors like UBS and others significantly increased positions in Q3 2025.

title: Investors Buy Large Volume of GSI Technology Call Options
summary: On December 26, 2025, investors purchased a large volume of call options for GSI Technology (NASDAQ:GSIT), signaling bullish sentiment amid recent stock momentum. This follows significant insider selling by two VPs disposing of large stakes, though insiders retain about 25.40% ownership. Analyst consensus remains a 'Sell' rating.

title: GF Closes Divestment of GF Machining Solutions to United Grinding Group
summary: GF has completed the divestment of its GF Machining Solutions division to United Grinding Group for CHF 630 million, resulting in a significant one-time book gain in the first half of 2025. The cash flow will repay acquisition-related debt and strengthen the balance sheet, with the Mid-Year 2025 Report rescheduled to July 24 for transparency. This allows GF to focus on its Flow Solutions businesses.[1]

title: Registration is Open for GEAPS Exchange 2026
summary: Registration is now open for GEAPS Exchange 2026, scheduled for February 21-24, 2026, at the Kansas City Convention Center. Grain handling and processing professionals can secure their spots for education and networking. The event returns to Kansas City, MO, hosted by GEAPS.

title: IOMSA Golden Ticket for Grain Processing Professionals Returns
summary: The IOMSA Golden Ticket Award is back, offering winners complimentary GEAPS Exchange 2026 registration and a $500 travel stipend. Grain processing professionals can apply now to experience the education and networking at the February 21-24, 2026 conference. This program promotes professional development in the industry.

title: GEAPS is Seeking Board of Director Candidates
summary: GEAPS has opened applications for Board of Director candidates as featured in the December 2025/January 2026 In-Grain newsletter. This call supports leadership opportunities and organizational governance. Interested professionals are encouraged to apply to shape the society's direction.

title: Turning Rebate Dollars Into Impact: GEAPS Chapters Receive Boost
summary: GEAPS chapters are utilizing rebate dollars to fund complimentary registrations, a $6,000 investment in future ag leaders, no-cost events, and better speakers. This initiative fuels momentum and impact within chapters like never before. It highlights ongoing efforts to enhance member engagement and industry development.

title: GEAPS Management Basics for Grain Facility Supervisors Course Launched
summary: The Grain Elevator and Processing Society (GEAPS) recently launched a new online course, Management Basics for Grain Facility Supervisors. This dynamic multimedia training equips frontline leaders in grain handling and processing facilities with essential leadership and operations skills. It aims to strengthen capabilities in the grain industries.

title: GATX Rail Europe Annual Wrap-Up 2025 Highlights Acquisitions, Fleet Expansion, and Workshop Consolidation
summary: GATX Rail Europe reports a year of growth, including regulatory approval for acquiring approximately 6,000 freight cars from DB Cargo via sale-and-leaseback, expanding its European fleet to over 36,500 railcars. The company also introduced new intermodal railcar superstructures and plans to close its Płock workshop while expanding in Ostróda, Poland. These moves strengthen GATX's position in railcar leasing amid challenging markets.

title: GATX Corporation Announces Quarterly Dividend of $0.61 per Share
summary: GATX Corporation's board declared a quarterly dividend of $0.61 per common share, payable on December 31, 2025. This continues GATX's long-standing practice of uninterrupted quarterly dividends since 1919. The announcement reflects steady financial performance amid ongoing business developments.

title: GATX Corporation and Brookfield Infrastructure Receive All Required Regulatory Clearances for Wells Fargo Rail Assets Acquisition
summary: GATX Corporation, together with Brookfield Infrastructure, has received all necessary regulatory approvals to acquire Wells Fargo's rail operating lease portfolio through a joint venture. The transaction, originally announced on May 29, 2025, is expected to close on or about January 1, 2026, significantly expanding GATX's North American fleet from 111,000 to 216,000 railcars. GATX will issue further details upon closing.

title: GE Vernova Awarded Major HVDC Contract for 2.5 GW Khavda-South Olpad Transmission Corridor
summary: GE Vernova's Electrification Systems won a major contract from Adani Energy Solutions Ltd. to supply HVDC technology for India's 2.5 GW renewable power transmission corridor. The deal supports grid modernization and the energy transition with advanced transmission systems. It reinforces GE Vernova's role in electrifying and decarbonizing global energy.

title: GE Secures Major LEAP-1B Engine Deal with Pegasus Airlines and U.S. Navy R&D Contract
summary: General Electric landed a significant LEAP-1B engine deal with Pegasus Airlines and a U.S. Navy contract for its F414 fighter jet engine program. These wins contribute to strong share price momentum, with analysts viewing GE as 6.8% undervalued at a fair value of $339.69. They highlight aerospace growth, supply chain improvements, and investments unlocking services demand.

title: GE Vernova Awarded Contract to Modernize Chandrapur HVDC Link in India
summary: GE Vernova's Electrification Systems business secured a contract from Power Grid Corporation of India to refurbish the 1,000 MW Chandrapur back-to-back HVDC link. The project upgrades converter stations with advanced controls, protection systems, and valves manufactured in India. It enhances grid reliability and supports India's sustainable power system.

title: GE Vernova Expects 80-GW Gas Turbine Backlog by End of 2025 and Strong Electrification Growth
summary: GE Vernova anticipates ending 2025 with an 80-GW gas turbine backlog extending into 2029, driven by 18 GW of Q4 orders and strong pricing. The electrification segment projects 25% revenue growth in 2025 and 20% in 2026, fueled by an electrification supercycle and orders from hyperscalers. The $5.3 billion Prolec GE acquisition remains on track for mid-2026 closure.

title: Balaguer Rolls Highlights Global Reach of State-of-the-Art Measuring Instruments and Machinery
summary: Balaguer Rolls proudly announces that its advanced measuring instruments and machinery are present in more than 80 countries worldwide. This underscores the company's extensive international technology deployment.

title: Balaguer Rolls Announces Participation in VICTAM LATAM Conference & Expo 2025
summary: Fundiciones Balaguer, operating as Balaguer Rolls, will participate in the VICTAM LATAM Conference & Expo 2025. The company expressed excitement about the event, highlighting their involvement in this industry gathering.

title: U.S. and China Postpone Port Fees Under Section 301, Restoring Normal Freight Service Rotations
summary: The U.S. and China have delayed port fees under the USTR Section 301 investigation for one year, avoiding changes to services like Maersk's TP7 U.S.-flagged route. This allows a return to normal rotations including Ningbo calls, benefiting freight forwarders on Asia-North America trades. The decision follows a spike and decline in Shanghai Containerized Freight Index post-Golden Week.

title: Nearshoring Drives Surging Demand for Cross-Border Logistics and Warehousing Along U.S.-Mexico Corridor
summary: The ongoing nearshoring trend is fueling increased demand for warehousing, cross-border logistics, and supply chain optimization between the U.S. and Mexico. Mexico remains America's top trading partner with September trade hitting $71.8 billion, emphasizing trucking's role. This development supports freight forwarders handling U.S.-Mexico flows amid stabilizing ground transportation.

title: Freight Forwarders Gear Up for Continued Volatility with Trade Lane Expansion, Cost Reduction, and Tech Investments
summary: Freight forwarders are proactively preparing for 2026 by diversifying into new trade lanes, implementing cost-saving measures, and boosting technology investments. This strategy addresses persistent market volatility in air and ocean freight. The approach aims to enhance operational efficiency amid softening demand and capacity challenges.

title: Regulatory Changes Including EU CBAM, Canada Steel Surtax, and Mexico Tariff Reform to Impact Freight Forwarders' Compliance and Costs
summary: Major regulatory updates such as the EU Carbon Border Adjustment Mechanism (CBAM), Canada's new steel surtax, and Mexico's tariff reform are set to affect landed costs and customs compliance for importers and exporters in 2026. These changes come amid steady freight forwarding operations with growing air cargo volumes and ongoing Red Sea route concerns. Freight forwarders must adapt to ensure supply chain resilience.

title: U.S. Flour Milling Industry Demonstrates Stability and Innovation Despite Production Decline
summary: The U.S. flour milling sector shows resilience with stable prospects in 2025, despite a 2% drop in Q2 flour production to 102.9 million hundredweights. Industry leaders highlighted innovations, new facilities by Greenfield and Star of the West, Mennel Milling's acquisition, and potential HB4 drought-resistant wheat adoption. Assessment presented at NAMA conference in October.

title: Cairnspring Mills Partners with Umatilla Tribes to Open New Flour Mill in Eastern Oregon
summary: Washington-based Cairnspring Mills partnered with the Confederated Tribes of the Umatilla Indian Reservation to build a new flour mill on tribal land, expanding production capacity twelvefold. The facility will process locally sourced regenerative wheat and supply North American customers. The partnership was highlighted on December 15.

title: USDA Approves $25M Loan Guarantee for Blue Mountain Flour Mill on CTUIR Tribal Land
summary: USDA Rural Development approved a $25 million loan guarantee for Cairnspring Mills' Blue Mountain Mill, a regenerative flour mill under construction on the Umatilla Indian Reservation in Oregon. The financing, part of a $65 million structure, supports construction and aims to restore regional milling capacity while creating 20-25 jobs. The deal was announced on December 16.

title: Minority Shareholders of Flour Mills of Nigeria to Receive ₦86 per Share Post-Delisting
summary: Following NGX delisting, minority shareholders will receive ₦86 per share held as of December 10, 2024, after a 10% withholding tax deduction, an increase from the initial ₦70 offer. The payout stems from the court-approved buyout by Excelsior Shipping on November 14, 2024. Shares have been transferred to majority shareholders.

title: Nigerian Exchange Delists Flour Mills of Nigeria from Daily Official List
summary: The Nigerian Exchange (NGX) has delisted the entire issued share capital of Flour Mills of Nigeria Plc effective December 30, 2024, following a suspension on December 16, 2024, and shareholder approval of a buyout by majority shareholder Excelsior Shipping Company Limited. This completes the privatization process initiated in September 2024 with SEC approval. Shares last traded on December 13, 2024, at N81.80.

title: Flex CEO Discusses AI Role in Bloomberg Open Interest Interview
summary: Flex's newsroom highlighted a December 5, 2025, Bloomberg interview with CEO on Flex as the 'quiet giant behind AI.' A December 3 article covered rearchitecting data centers for power and compute needs.

title: Manchester Financial Inc. Makes New $1.88 Million Investment in Flex Ltd.
summary: Manchester Financial Inc. purchased a new stake of 32,395 shares in Flex during Q3, valued at approximately $1.88 million. This investment reflects institutional interest amid recent analyst upgrades, including KeyCorp raising its price target to $75.

title: Flex Stock Jumps 3.5% as Goldman Sachs Raises Price Target to $74 on AI Data Center Growth
summary: Goldman Sachs increased its price target on Flex from $67 to $74 with a Buy rating, citing strong growth in AI data center and utility sectors. Flex highlighted 35% growth in these businesses during an investor conference, driven by integrated solutions. Shares reached a 52-week high of $69.94, up 81.1% year-to-date.

title: Flex Accelerates AI Data Center Expansion with New Platforms, LG Partnership, and Upward Fiscal 2026 Guidance
summary: Flex announced a partnership with LG Electronics to co-develop integrated modular cooling systems for AI data centers. The company revised fiscal 2026 revenue guidance to $26.7–$27.3 billion, up $500 million, with adjusted EPS of $3.09–$3.17 and operating margins of 6.2–6.3%. Data center revenues are on track for $6.5 billion, representing 35% year-over-year growth.

title: Flex Reports Record Free Cash Flow and Expects 35% Data Center Revenue Growth Amid Macro Pressures
summary: Flex Ltd. generated a record $1.1 billion in free cash flow for fiscal 2025 and $305 million in Q2 fiscal 2026, with management confident in over 80% free cash flow conversion. The company anticipates at least 35% growth in data center revenues this year, driven by AI power, compute, and cooling solutions despite tariff and forex headwinds. Fiscal 2026 outlook includes balanced growth across segments.

title: Ever.Ag Grain Feed Podcast Analyzes Holiday Feed Markets and 2026 Outlook Amid Weather and Crop Uncertainties
summary: The year-end episode discusses corn recovery, soybean pressure, emerging feed opportunities from South American disruptions, and dairy market volatility. Experts highlight seasonal demand, exports, and upcoming USDA data risks as key factors for 2026. Episode previews changes to the podcast format.

title: Whole Foods and Mill Partner to Deploy AI-Powered Food Recycling Tech for Chicken Feed Production
summary: Whole Foods Market will deploy Mill Commercial technology starting 2027 to process fruit and vegetable scraps into nutrient-rich chicken feed for its private-label egg suppliers. The AI-driven system reduces waste by up to 80% and supports Whole Foods' goal to halve food waste by 2030. Partnership aims to cut costs, enhance supply chain circularity, and stabilize feed prices.

title: Alltech Releases 2025 Agri-Food Outlook Showing Global Feed Production Rebound to 1.396 Billion Metric Tons
summary: Alltech's annual global feed production survey indicates a 1.2% increase in 2024 to 1.396 billion metric tons despite challenges like HPAI and economic uncertainty. Poultry and dairy feed saw growth, while pig feed outlook remains pessimistic. Data collected in Q1 2025 from feed mills worldwide highlights industry resilience.

title: Fairbanks Scales Offers New Roller Conveyor Scale
summary: Fairbanks Scales has launched a new Roller Conveyor Scale providing a manual conveyor weighing option. Announced on December 23, 2025, this product enhances weighing capabilities in industrial settings.

title: Fairbanks Scales Unveils FB1150 Industrial Scale Instrument
summary: Fairbanks Scales Inc. has introduced the FB1150 industrial scale instrument, a breakthrough solution for optimizing weighing in transportation and warehousing. The instrument is dated December 22, 2025, within the past 7 days.

title: Parish Rice Founder Praises Partnership with Falcon Rice Mill
summary: Parish Rice founder highlights Falcon Rice Mill in Crowley for handling all their milling and packaging needs. He describes them as great people who are easy to work with, especially for maintaining separation of smaller volume, domestic rice batches.

title: Falcon Rice Mill Launches $6M Upgrade
summary: Falcon Rice Mill in Crowley has launched a $6 million renovation project aimed at increasing operational efficiency. The upgrade is expected to create 16 new jobs.

title: Foss & Company Partners with GridStor on $86 Million Tax Credit Transfer for Hidden Lakes BESS Project
summary: Foss & Company completed an $86 million direct transfer of investment tax credits for GridStor's 220 MW/440 MWh Hidden Lakes Reliability battery storage project in Texas. This marks Foss & Company's first collaboration with GridStor, supporting ERCOT market services and clean energy infrastructure. Executives from both firms expressed enthusiasm for future partnerships.[6]

title: FOSS Group Acquires Wasatch Photonics
summary: Danish instrumentation company FOSS has acquired Wasatch Photonics, a North American specialist in spectrometers and optical components, marking a major expansion into the photonics sector. The acquisition, one of the largest in FOSS's history, integrates Wasatch into a new FOSS Photonics division while allowing independent operations. FOSS CEO Kim Vejlby Hansen highlighted the strategic fit for innovation in optical components across industries.[1][3][5][8]

title: Control Assemblies, Extron, and RRAMAC Unite to Expand Capabilities in Automation, Manufacturing, and Connected Technologies
summary: Control Assemblies, Extron, and RRAMAC announced a partnership on December 17, 2025, to expand capabilities in automation, manufacturing, and connected technologies.

title: Extron Now Shipping Two New CS Series Column Array Loudspeakers
summary: Extron announced shipping of two new CA Series models, including the CA 83T 30-inch column array loudspeaker. These additions enhance Extron's audio offerings for various applications.

title: Extron Debuts New DTP3 T 211 Long-Distance Transmitter for USB-C Video
summary: Extron introduced the DTP3 T 211 transmitter on December 18, 2025, for long-distance transmission of USB-C video and bidirectional RS-232. This new product expands Extron's DTP3 capabilities for AV extension.

title: Extron and HETMA Forge Strategic Partnership to Revolutionize AV Solutions for Campus Learning
summary: Extron and HETMA announced a strategic partnership on December 22, 2025, to co-develop training and certification programs for AV solutions in higher education. The collaboration aims to enhance campus learning environments through innovative AV technologies.

title: Extron Releases Second Edition of 2025 New Products Brochure
summary: Extron launched the second edition of its 2025 New Products Brochure, adding new AV solutions like NAV SD 121, DTP3 CrossPoint Series, UCS SW 313, NetPA 204 POE, and column array speakers. It builds on the first edition with enhancements and new platforms for signal distribution, collaboration, and control. The brochure focuses on simplifying integration and performance.

title: Extron Releases 2025 New Products Brochure – First Edition
summary: Extron has released its 2025 New Products Brochure, featuring advancements in AV technology for signal distribution, collaboration, streaming, and control. Highlighted products include DTP3 IN2004 Series, DTP3 CrossPoint Series, Quantum Ultra II DTP3, and others, many now shipping. Casey Hall, Chief Marketing Officer, emphasized innovative solutions for enhanced performance and integration.

title: Corn Inspections Surge Year-to-Date While Soybeans Exports Trail Significantly
summary: U.S. grain export inspections through early November showed corn up 66% year-over-year, wheat up 19%, but soybeans and sorghum lagging. Total volumes were 1.5% above last year, driven by strong corn and wheat demand amid divergent commodity trends. Basis and logistics remain commodity-specific.

title: U.S. Grain Export Inspections Rise from Prior Week, Flash Soybean Sale to China Confirmed
summary: USDA reported higher grain export inspections for the week ended December 18, 2025, with corn at 1.74 million metric tons, soybeans at 870,199 tons, and wheat at 627,443 tons, mostly exceeding last year's levels. A new flash sale of 396,000 tons of soybeans to China was confirmed for 2025/26 and 2026/27 delivery. CBOT grain futures rose in response.

title: Corn Export Revisions Spark December WASDE with Record First-Quarter Inspections
summary: The USDA's December WASDE report increased U.S. corn export projections by 125 million bushels to 3.2 billion bushels due to record first-quarter export inspections exceeding 19 million metric tons, up 22% from last year. This reflects robust global demand and expanded market reach to new destinations like Vietnam and Spain. Soybeans and wheat saw minimal changes.

title: Esra Vuslat Candan of Erkaya Emphasizes Quality as Basic Element in Flour Analysis
summary: In a Miller Magazine article dated December 19, 2025, Esra Vuslat Candan from Erkaya Laboratory Instruments & Improvers states that quality is the basic element in flour production. The piece discusses advancements in milling technology and Erkaya's contributions. It positions Erkaya as a leader in efficient flour analysis equipment.

title: Erkaya Appointed as Exclusive Representative in Russia for Modern Laboratory Solutions
summary: Erkaya Laboratory Instruments has been announced as the exclusive representative in Russia by Kolba24.ru, offering comprehensive modern laboratory solutions under key. The news highlights their role in providing advanced lab equipment for the Russian market. Published on December 25, 2025.

title: Engrain Announces Robust Support of Fee Transparency in SightMap
summary: Engrain introduced fee transparency features in its SightMap platform, allowing renters to view full apartment costs including base rent and fees. The update includes customization options, powerful leasing tools, and a user-friendly experience. This enhances compliance and transparency for multifamily operators.

title: Jonah and Engrain Align to Support FTC Price Transparency Expectations Across Multifamily Websites
summary: On December 17, 2025, Jonah and Engrain announced a partnership to integrate fee transparency features into property websites, enabling real-time pricing visibility and total cost calculators. They converted over 1,000 websites in 30 days to meet FTC warnings on accurate fee disclosure. This collaboration helps operators comply with regulations while improving renter experiences.

title: Engrain Sets a New Standard for Multifamily Fee Transparency With Advanced Calculator-Agnostic Fee Data Integrations and Expanded API Tooling
summary: Engrain announced a major expansion of its fee transparency capabilities on December 18, 2025, including advanced calculator-agnostic fee data integrations and enhanced API tooling. This update supports multifamily operators in delivering consistent, compliant all-in pricing across websites and partner systems. The platform aims to simplify transparent pricing and build trust amid evolving regulations.

title: UST Acquires Majority Stake in Italdesign Giugiaro from Lamborghini
summary: UST has acquired a majority stake in Italdesign Giugiaro from Lamborghini, with Audi Group remaining a long-term strategic partner. The deal combines UST’s automotive engineering, AI, and software expertise with Italdesign’s design, prototyping, and production capabilities to offer integrated services globally.[8]

title: Innoviz Launches InnovizThree LiDAR Sensor for Flexible Integration
summary: Innoviz has launched the InnovizThree LiDAR sensor, weighing 600g with a 13W low-power mode, detection beyond 250 meters, and pricing over 35% lower than InnovizTwo. The sensor targets flexible integration in automotive and other applications.[7]

title: UMaine's Advanced Structures and Composites Center Partners with Kairos Power and ORNL on 3D-Printed Concrete Form Liners for Nuclear Construction
summary: Engineers at UMaine’s ASCC and ORNL developed and 3D-printed specialized sinusoidal concrete form liners for Kairos Power's nuclear projects, producing full-scale 27-foot-tall wall segments. This hybrid system accelerates construction, cuts costs, and demonstrates large-scale manufacturing for energy infrastructure.[3]

title: Archer Aviation Hires Dr. Limhi Somerville as Veteran British eVTOL Engineer for U.K. Engineering Hub
summary: Archer Aviation announced on December 15 that Dr. Limhi Somerville, a top British eVTOL engineering leader from Vertical Aerospace, will join in early 2026 to support the company's U.K. engineering hub plans. Somerville previously held roles at Jaguar Land Rover and the University of Warwick.[1]

title: HydroGraph Clean Power Adds Aerospace and Graphene Expert James Baker to Technical Advisory Board
summary: HydroGraph Clean Power Inc. has appointed James Baker, with over three decades of experience in advanced materials, aerospace, defense, and graphene commercialization, to its technical advisory board. This addition strengthens the company's expertise ahead of 2026.[1]

title: Principle Power Appoints João Amaral as New CEO
summary: Floating wind technology company Principle Power has announced João Amaral as its new chief executive officer, succeeding Julian Arrilaga Costa who will remain in an advisory role until the end of 2025. This leadership transition aims to ensure a smooth handover into 2026.[1]

title: U.S. Treasury Electronic Trading Rebounds with Record ADNV
summary: Coalition Greenwich forecasts U.S. Treasury market ADNV to exceed $1 trillion daily for the first time in 2025, with 9 of 12 months surpassing this level. April set a record at $1.3 trillion per day. The rebound underscores growth in electronic trading volumes.

title: High Yield Market Continues Push Towards E-Trading
summary: Coalition Greenwich reports the high yield corporate bond market advancing electronic trading adoption, with October ADNV at $51 billion, up 4% from October 2024. Data from market makers and platforms highlights ongoing trends in credit market electronification. This reflects broader shifts in fixed income electronic trading.

title: CFTC Acting Chairman Pham Announces Launch of Digital Assets Pilot Program for Tokenized Collateral
summary: On December 8, CFTC Acting Chairman Pham launched a pilot program allowing BTC, ETH, and USDC as collateral in derivatives markets, along with guidance on tokenized collateral. This follows withdrawal of outdated requirements post-GENIUS Act enactment. The initiative advances digital assets integration in regulated electronic trading.

title: ESMA Finalizes Technical Standards on Derivatives Transparency and OTC Derivatives Tape
summary: ESMA published its Final Report on December 15 covering MiFIR Review mandates for derivatives trade transparency, package orders, and OTC derivatives consolidated tape. The standards introduce pre- and post-trade transparency for exchange-traded and OTC derivatives while protecting liquidity providers. This supports improved transparency in electronic derivatives trading.

title: ESMA Selects EuroCTP as First Consolidated Tape Provider for Shares and ETFs
summary: On December 19, ESMA selected EuroCTP as the first Consolidated Tape Provider for shares and ETFs in the EU, enhancing equity market transparency. EuroCTP met all selection criteria under MiFIR regulations. This step advances post-trade transparency in electronic trading environments.

title: ICMA Publishes White Paper on Electronic Distribution of Bond Market Axes
summary: ICMA and FIX Trading Community released a white paper on December 16, 2025, examining practices and challenges in electronically distributing bond market axes across Europe. It discusses adaptations to electronic trading, inconsistencies in axe data, and operational pressures from automation. The paper aims to foster discussion on improving pre-trade transparency in bond markets.

title: BGC Group Announces Agreement to Sell kACE Financial to smartTrade Technologies
summary: BGC Group has entered a definitive agreement to sell its kACE Financial business, a provider of real-time pricing and analytics for FX derivatives, to smartTrade Technologies for up to $119 million. The deal unlocks shareholder value and allows kACE to integrate with smartTrade's multi-asset electronic trading platforms. Executives from both companies highlighted the strategic fit and growth potential.

title: Electro-Sensors, Inc.'s (NASDAQ:ELSE) Stock Has Shown Weakness Lately But Financial Prospects Look Decent: Is The Market Wrong?
summary: Electro-Sensors' stock has declined 19% over the past three months despite decent financial indicators, including a 34% net income growth over five years and a 2.8% ROE. The company reinvests all profits without paying dividends, contributing to earnings growth. Analysts suggest the market may undervalue its long-term fundamentals.

title: Enterprise Products Partners Acquires Occidental's Natural Gas Gathering Affiliate for $580 Million
summary: Enterprise Products Partners agreed to acquire Occidental's natural gas gathering affiliate for $580 million in cash, adding 200 miles of pipelines and access to over 1,000 drillable locations in the Midland Basin. This strategic acquisition expands EPD's midstream footprint through multiple agreements with Occidental.

title: Enterprise Products Partners Expands Buyback Program to $5 Billion
summary: EPD announced an expansion of its common unit buyback program to $5.0 billion from $2.0 billion, with $3.6 billion still available as of late 2025. This move signals management's belief that shares are undervalued and aims to enhance returns for remaining unitholders.

title: Invesco Ltd. Buys 69,505 Shares of Enterprise Products Partners L.P.
summary: Invesco Ltd. purchased 69,505 shares of EPD on December 4, 2025. This institutional investment reflects confidence in the company's fundamentals amid its recent quarterly earnings and dividend announcement.

title: Morgan Stanley Downgrades Enterprise Products Partners (EPD) to Underweight
summary: On December 18, 2025, Morgan Stanley downgraded EPD from Equal Weight to Underweight with a $34 price target, citing challenges in keeping pace with the midstream group without a clearer growth story. The analyst noted that buybacks alone are unlikely to drive a meaningful re-rating as the company transitions post-heavy investment period.

title: Veneer Technologies Installs New High-Capacity Drum Chipper at North Carolina Mill
summary: Veneer Technologies integrated a new DH-V 200/300 × 650 drum chipper from Bruks Siwertell at its Newport, North Carolina facility in June 2025, replacing an older unit. The equipment enhances operational reliability, capacity, and material flow for producing high-quality veneer products.

title: Asphalt Drum Mixers (ADM) Unveils EX 8845 High-Capacity Asphalt Plant at World of Asphalt 2025
summary: Asphalt Drum Mixers (ADM) is showcasing the EX 8845 asphalt drum mix plant at World of Asphalt 2025, featuring an 88-inch drum diameter and 45-foot length for up to 425 TPH production. The counterflow technology ensures quality asphalt, handles up to 50% RAP, and meets strict environmental regulations by reducing emissions.

title: Douglas Products Appoints Michael Hamby as Chief Commercial Officer
summary: Douglas Products has appointed Michael Hamby as its new chief commercial officer, responsible for commercial operations including sales, marketing, and customer operations. This leadership addition aims to strengthen the company's commercial strategy.

title: Douglas Group Launches Three New Exclusive Brands in Q4 FY 2024/25
summary: In the fourth quarter, Douglas introduced exclusive brands NEST, Iräye, and Drybar, alongside a new campaign platform for consistent branding across 22 omnichannel countries. These initiatives complement supply chain improvements, including a new OWAC warehouse in Poland enhancing service and delivery. The moves support omnichannel growth, with e-commerce up 5.6% excluding Disapo.

title: Douglas Group Plans Middle East Expansion Amid Strong FY 2024/25 Results
summary: Following robust full-year results, Douglas is evaluating market entry into the Middle East and Gulf Cooperation Council countries to capitalize on premium beauty potential outside continental Europe. CEO Sander van der Laan highlighted opportunities in market consolidation, supported by ongoing store network growth with 74 net new stores and 139 modernizations, reaching 1,959 stores total. This aligns with broader ambitions in a rebalancing market.

title: Douglas Group Reports Solid Sales Growth and Doubles Net Income for FY 2024/25
summary: Douglas Group's sales rose to €4.58 billion, up 2.8% or 3.5% excluding Disapo divestment, with net income more than doubling to €175.4 million and adjusted EBITDA margin at 16.8%. Despite a challenging Q4 due to consumer price sensitivity and promotional competition, the company achieved its guidance and plans sales growth to €4.65-4.80 billion in FY 2025/26. Strategic investments continue in IT, AI, store expansion, and potential Middle East market entry.

title: Didion Milling Fails to Implement CSB Safety Recommendations Following 2017 Explosions
summary: The U.S. Chemical Safety and Hazard Investigation Board (CSB) reported that Didion Milling has not implemented any of nine safety recommendations from its December 2023 final report on the fatal 2017 explosions at the Cambria, Wisconsin facility. Despite multiple outreach efforts, including a letter on August 5, 2025, Didion has provided no substantive response. The CSB may close the recommendations as 'Unacceptable Response/No Response Received' if no action is taken.

title: Depart and ISG Pack Sign Collaboration Agreement
summary: Depart Packaging Solutions has expanded its product range by signing an agency agreement with ISG Pack. This partnership adds new packaging machines to Depart's offerings. The agreement strengthens Depart's position in the packaging sector for milling and related industries.

title: Award-winning Alexander Dennis Enviro100AEV Autonomous Buses Deployed on Roads in Cambridge
summary: Alexander Dennis has launched its award-winning Enviro100AEV autonomous electric buses in Cambridge. These vehicles represent a milestone in autonomous public transport deployment. The initiative showcases advancements in zero-emission and self-driving technology.

title: Scottish Government Moves to Save Hundreds of Jobs at Alexander Dennis Amid Controversies
summary: The Scottish Government is intervening to save hundreds of jobs at Alexander Dennis, a bus manufacturer facing challenges. This action comes amid ongoing controversies surrounding the company. The move highlights efforts to support the local economy and employment in the region.

title: Romanian Footwear Producer Denis Launches Online Shop Targeting EUR 1 Mln Revenues
summary: Romanian footwear producer and retailer Denis has recently opened an online shop, aiming to generate EUR 1 million in sales through the platform. The new channel includes opportunities for sales abroad, expanding their market reach.[2]

title: Denis Chem Lab Stock Falls to 52-Week Low of Rs.76 Amidst Prolonged Underperformance
summary: On December 22, 2025, Denis Chem Lab's share price hit its 52-week low of Rs.76, marking a -57.16% return over the past year compared to the Sensex's 9.48% gain. Recent nine-month profit after tax contracted by 35.25% to Rs.5.40 crore, despite modest long-term sales growth and zero debt-to-equity ratio. The stock trades below major moving averages, indicating continued downward momentum.[1]

title: DaVita Names New Chief People Officer and Chief Strategy Officer
summary: DaVita appointed new leaders as Chief People Officer and Chief Strategy Officer on December 11, 2025, to accelerate care transformation and underscore commitment to innovation and a people-first approach.[5][6][7][8]

title: Ransomware Attack Disrupts DaVita Operations and Encrypts Network
summary: DaVita disclosed a ransomware attack that impacted some operations and encrypted parts of its network, prompting activation of response protocols and contingency plans. The company notified the SEC and continues patient care, but cannot yet estimate disruption duration or financial impact.[2]

title: DaVita Stock Hits New 1-Year Low After Earnings Miss and Analyst Downgrades
summary: DaVita reported quarterly EPS of $2.51, missing estimates of $3.17, with revenue at $3.42B roughly in line, and issued FY2025 guidance of 10.35–11.15 EPS. Several analysts cut price targets and ratings, such as Barclays to $143 and TD Cowen to $133, resulting in a 'Hold' consensus rating.[1]

title: Davis Commodities Faces Margin Pressure from Regulatory Changes and Cost Inflation Despite Revenue Growth
summary: Revenue growth was hampered by China's December 2024 ban on premix sugar imports from Thailand, causing sharp declines in Thailand revenue (down 81.7%), alongside higher logistics and raw material costs not fully passed to customers. This led to a 9.8% gross profit drop and 96.9% net income decline in H1 FY2025. The company is pivoting geographically to Africa and China to offset impacts.

title: Davis Commodities Announces Strategic Pivot to Blockchain Tokenization and New FMCG Division with $30M Fundraising Plan
summary: Davis Commodities is transforming from a traditional trader to a tech-enabled platform, launching a blockchain-powered agricultural tokenization platform targeting the $16 trillion RWA market and a new FMCG division via Davis Commodities SEA Pte. Ltd. The ambitious pivot includes a $30 million fundraising plan and involvement in a $1B ESG project for digitizing trade routes. Analysts note high execution risks amid volatile markets and thin margins.

title: Davis Commodities Limited Reports First Half of Fiscal Year 2025 Unaudited Financial Results
summary: Davis Commodities announced H1 FY2025 revenue surged 42% to $95 million, driven by strong growth in Africa (up 64.9%) and rice sales (up 41.3%), though net profit fell sharply to $0.04 million due to margin compression from higher costs and regulatory changes like China's ban on premix sugar imports. Executive Chairperson Li Peng Leck highlighted efforts to expand markets and mitigate fluctuations via logistics. The results triggered a positive stock reaction, with shares rising 5.6% pre-market and up to 11.94% in after-hours.

title: North Dakota Industrial Commission Approves $8.3 Million Scale Upgrade for North Dakota Mill
summary: The North Dakota Industrial Commission approved $8.3 million to upgrade scales in the truck unloading facilities at the North Dakota Mill & Elevator. This investment aims to improve operational efficiency at the facility.

title: North Dakota Mill Reports Profit Increase for FY 2025
summary: For FY 2025, North Dakota Mill transferred 52.5% of its profits, totaling $12,679,845, to the state's general fund and $1,334,720 to the agricultural products fund. This reflects a significant profit increase for the state-owned mill.

title: North Dakota Mill CEO Vance Taylor to Retire After 25 Years of Record-Setting Leadership
summary: North Dakota Mill President and CEO Vance Taylor plans to retire on July 3, 2026, after over 25 years in the role, the longest-serving in the mill's 103-year history. Under his leadership, the mill innovated, expanded, and generated record profits, including major capital investments and facility upgrades. A nationwide search is underway for a successor to ensure a smooth transition.

title: Spat Over 'Healthy Pasta' Settles for $7.9 Million
summary: A class action lawsuit against Dakota Growers Pasta Co. over false claims about Dreamfields pasta's glycemic index and digestive carbs has settled for $7.9 million. The settlement resolves allegations under the New Jersey Consumer Fraud Act and other state laws, with Dakota Growers denying wrongdoing but agreeing to avoid trial. Final approval was granted by a New Jersey federal judge.

title: Disney Destiny to Commence Sailings in December 2025
summary: Disney Cruise Line announced that its new heroes and villains-themed ship, Disney Destiny, will begin revenue operations and maiden voyage from Fort Lauderdale in December 2025. This Wish-class ship is part of DCL's expansion plans, unaffected by other delays.

title: Disney Cruise Line Takes Delivery of Largest Ship Disney Adventure
summary: Disney Cruise Line formally took delivery of Disney Adventure, its largest vessel at 208,000 gross tons, from Meyer Werft shipyard on December 16, 2025. The handover ceremony marked the transition to final outfitting, including interior theming and crew training, ahead of its March 2026 debut from Singapore. This expands DCL's fleet to eight ships and marks its entry into the Southeast Asian market.

title: Disney Cruise Line Postpones Disney Adventure Maiden Voyage to March 2026
summary: Disney Cruise Line has delayed the maiden voyage of its largest ship, Disney Adventure, from December 15, 2025, to March 10, 2026, due to construction delays. Affected guests will be rebooked with a 50% discount, and those on earlier voyages receive full refunds plus the discount offer. The ship remains on track for Singapore-based operations in Southeast Asia.

title: Dakota Gold Reaches New 1-Year High Stock Price
summary: On December 22, 2025, Dakota Gold (NYSE:DC) hit a new 52-week high of $6.10, up ~4.7%, with a market cap of ~$690.3M, amid ongoing Richmond Hill project developments. The stock price reached $6.23 as of December 26, 2025, reflecting positive market sentiment toward the company's exploration progress in South Dakota's Homestake District.[1][5]

title: Dakota Gold Expansion Drilling Intersects High-Grade Gold Mineralization at Richmond Hill
summary: Dakota Gold Corp. announced on December 23, 2025, additional 2025 drill results from the Richmond Hill oxide heap leach project, including expansion holes extending gold mineralization 230 meters north of the current resource. Highlights include RH25C-295: 2.15 g/t Au over 30.0 m and RH25C-288: 4.15 g/t Au over 14.5 m, with the company having completed 242 drill holes totaling 29,279 meters and 106 assays pending. Northern mineralization remains open, supporting plans for ~27,500 m of drilling in 2025.[1][8]

title: Cotecna Consumer Product Services from Factory to Shelf
summary: Cotecna published an overview of its full service scope for Consumer Product Services, covering testing, inspection, and certification from factory production to shelf placement. This highlights comprehensive support for consumer product compliance.

title: Cotecna Launches FSC Chain of Custody Certification Services
summary: Cotecna has launched FSC Chain of Custody Certification services to certify products from responsibly sourced forests. This new offering supports clients in verifying sustainable sourcing practices.

title: Cotecna Brazil Introduces New Infosheet for Textiles and General Cargo Services
summary: Cotecna Brazil released a new infosheet detailing its inspection, testing, and audit solutions for the textile and industrial goods markets. The services aim to enhance supply chain transparency, regulatory compliance, and product quality for local manufacturers and importers.

title: Cotecna Launches New Consumer Product Services (CPS) Website
summary: Cotecna has launched a dedicated website for its Consumer Product Services (CPS), showcasing testing, inspection, certification, audit, and ESG services for softlines, hardlines, furniture, electrical, and electronic products. The site details testing for chemicals, reliability, physical properties, RF, and energy efficiency, along with full-cycle inspection services.

title: ACT Lab Approved as Amazon DV Provider and Shares Compliance Updates
summary: The ACT Lab December 2025 Newsletter highlights its approval as an Amazon Document Validation (DV) TIC provider for e-mobility devices in the U.S., Canada, and U.K. It also covers the reinstatement of EN 15194 for e-bikes in Australia and essential CPSC e-filing processes for 2026 compliance. These updates support manufacturers in navigating regulatory changes.

title: Cotecna Approved as Amazon TIC Direct Validation Body
summary: Cotecna has been officially recognized by Amazon as an approved Direct Validation (DV) body for categories including children’s toys, e-mobility devices, and accessories. This approval enables Cotecna to provide testing, compliance validation, and direct submission of results to Amazon, helping sellers meet requirements and expand into North America and Europe. Services include global compliance testing, documentation review, and process optimization.

title: Bluebird Flour from Cortez Milling Flies Out the Door Due to High Demand
summary: Bluebird Flour, manufactured at Cortez Milling in Southwest Colorado's grain basket northwest of Cortez, is praised for its freshness and local production. The flour sells out quickly once milled, highlighting strong consumer demand for local products.

title: Corbion Shares Dip After Unveiling BRIGHT 2030 Strategy at Capital Markets Day
summary: Corbion presented its BRIGHT 2030 strategy on November 20, 2025, targeting 3-6% organic sales growth for 2026-2028, 18% EBITDA margin by 2028, €270 million cumulative free cash flow, and double-digit EPS growth. Shares fell despite positive long-term targets. The strategy highlights operational streamlining and balance sheet strengthening.

title: Corbion Signs USD 100 Million Debt Issuance in US Private Placement Market
summary: Corbion announced a Note Purchase Agreement for USD 100 million at a fixed 5.11% interest rate with 7-year maturity, signed on November 7, 2025. Final closing and funding are set for December 18, 2025, with proceeds to repay maturing debt. This aligns Corbion's debt maturity profile.

title: Conagra Brands Reports Q2 Loss with $968M Impairment Charge but Reaffirms Fiscal 2026 Guidance
summary: Conagra Brands reported a net loss of $663.6 million for its fiscal Q2 ended November 23, 2025, due to a $968 million non-cash goodwill impairment triggered by a sustained decline in share price. Despite soft demand, declining volumes, and sales drop to $2.98 billion, the company maintained its full-year forecasts of net sales between a 1% decline and 1% rise, and adjusted EPS of $1.70-$1.85. Management expressed optimism about momentum in frozen foods and snacks, planning continued margin investment for volume growth.

title: Conagra Brands Reports Q2 Loss with $968M Impairment Charge but Reaffirms Fiscal 2026 Guidance
summary: Conagra Brands reported a net loss of $663.6 million for its fiscal Q2 ended November 23, 2025, due to a $968 million non-cash goodwill impairment triggered by a sustained stock price decline and higher discount rates. Despite soft demand, declining volumes, and sales drop to $2.98 billion, the company maintained its full-year outlook of net sales between -1% to +1% and adjusted EPS of $1.70-$1.85. Management expressed optimism for organic net sales growth in the second half, focusing on frozen foods, snacks, and value-led innovation.

title: Columbia/Okura Unveils miniPAL+ Collaborative Palletizer with Universal Robots
summary: Columbia/Okura introduces the miniPAL+, a new collaborative palletizing solution featuring Universal Robot's UR20 cobot arm with a 44-lb lifting capacity. This product launch ties into their recent partnership for enhanced palletizing applications.[2][5]

title: Columbia/Okura Announces Strategic Alliance with Universal Robots
summary: Columbia/Okura LLC has announced a strategic alliance with Universal Robots to deliver an extensive range of collaborative robot solutions. This partnership enables the development of collaborative palletizing applications using Universal Robots' technology.[1][2]

title: Color-rich, New Look in a Jiffy for Chelsea Milling Co. Packaging
summary: Chelsea Milling Co. has introduced a color-rich new packaging design for its Jiffy products, highlighting the critical role of packaging in product sales. The update, noted on December 22, 2025, refreshes the iconic branding. This development underscores ongoing innovation in visual appeal for the baking mix line.

title: Chelsea Milling Incorporates AI System to Improve Ingredient Safety and Compliance
summary: Chelsea Milling has adopted an Intelligent Document Processing (IDP) AI system from TraceGains to automate certificate of analysis (COA) processing, eliminating manual reviews and enhancing accuracy for ingredient quality, safety, and compliance. The system, built on OpenAI's model, flags issues for human oversight and reduces processing time significantly. It supports the Jiffy Mix maker's supply chain efficiency.

title: Chelsea Milling Company Plans $35 Million Expansion to Dramatically Increase Output
summary: Chelsea Milling Co., maker of Jiffy baking mixes, is investing $35 million in a new $25 million mixing tower, packaging plant, and support facility to boost production from 120 million to over 350 million pounds per month. The upgrade targets larger packages for institutional and food service customers like Michigan prisons, while reducing workforce from 315 to 240 through attrition amid retirements. Owner Howdy Holmes emphasized adapting to shifts in consumer behavior toward eating out.

title: Cereatech, Inc. to Present at 2025 IAOM Conference & Expo on Mill Flow Lines and Pneumatic Systems
summary: Bulent Ozturk from Cereatech, Inc. is scheduled to present on 'Nervous System of Mills: Flow Lines and Pneumatic Conveying Systems Design' at the 2025 IAOM Conference & Expo. The event preview highlights this session as part of the milling industry's key gatherings. This indicates Cereatech's active involvement in industry events.

title: Atkinson Equipment Partners with Ceratizit UK & Ireland Ltd for Production Transformation
summary: Ceratizit UK & Ireland Ltd is featured in a December 23, 2025 press release for helping Atkinson Equipment tool up and transform production processes. The collaboration focuses on enhancing manufacturing capabilities through Ceratizit's offerings. Details on specific products or terms are limited in available reports.

title: CERATIZIT Acquires Majority Stake in Best Carbide Cutting Tools
summary: CERATIZIT's U.S. subsidiary acquired a majority stake in Best Carbide Cutting Tools, a California-based manufacturer of solid carbide round tools, for an undisclosed amount. The deal strengthens CERATIZIT's U.S. network and access to high-end micro tools, following their recent acquisition of Becker Diamantwerkzeuge. Executives highlighted benefits in technology sharing and manufacturing improvements.

title: CERATIZIT USA Agrees to Pay $54.4M to Settle False Claims Act Allegations on Evaded Customs Duties
summary: Ceratizit USA LLC settled with the U.S. Department of Justice for $54.4 million over allegations of evading Section 301 tariffs by transshipping Chinese tungsten carbide products through Taiwan and misclassifying them. The settlement, announced December 18, 2025, resolves claims of false country-of-origin declarations and improper tariff codes; a whistleblower receives about $9.75 million. DOJ reserves the right to pursue criminal charges.

title: Central Life Sciences Adds Kylie Sherrill to Technical Services Team
summary: Central Life Sciences has welcomed Kylie Sherrill to its technical services team, supporting the livestock feed additive and farm and ranch divisions. This addition strengthens the company's technical expertise in these areas.

title: Dover Acquires Select Assets from Carter Day International's Petrochemical Division
summary: Dover (NYSE: DOV) has acquired select assets from Carter Day International's petrochemical division, focusing on dryer manufacturer technology. This acquisition enhances Dover's capabilities in the global petrochemical market. Details on the specific assets and financial terms were not disclosed in the announcement.

title: MAAG Group Acquires Carter Day's Centrifugal Pellet Dryer Technology
summary: MAAG Group announced the acquisition of certain assets from Carter Day International, Inc., specifically the centrifugal pellet dryer technology for the petrochemical division, on December 20, 2024. This technology will be integrated into MAAG's product portfolio to strengthen its offerings in the global petrochemical industry. The deal positions MAAG to expand its drying solutions for plastics processing.

title: Dover Corporation Acquires Select Assets from Carter Day International's Petrochemical Division
summary: Dover Corporation (NYSE: DOV) has acquired select assets from Carter Day International's petrochemical division, specializing in dryer manufacturing technology. The acquisition supports global petrochemical industry applications. Reports confirm Dover as the acquiring entity for these assets.

summary: MAAG Group announced the acquisition of certain assets from Carter Day International, Inc.'s petrochemical division on December 20, 2024, focusing on centrifugal pellet dryer technology for dewatering and drying in the plastics industry. title: Carter's Plans to Close 150 Stores and Lay Off 15% of Workers
summary: Carter's will close 150 stores as leases expire and implement workforce reductions, targeting $35 million in annual savings through 2026 measures amid tariff impacts. This follows significant profitability declines reported earlier. The actions aim to streamline operations in response to economic pressures.

summary: MAAG has acquired Carter Day's centrifugal pellet dryer technology, integrating it into its product portfolio for the global petrochemical industry. This move enhances MAAG's offerings in plastics processing equipment. No further financial or timeline details were provided in the announcement.

title: Carter's (NYSE:CRI) Share Price Crosses Above 200-Day Moving Average
summary: Carter's stock rose above its 200-day moving average of $30.05, reaching $31.94 and closing at $32.78 on increased volume, signaling positive momentum. This follows Q3 earnings of $0.74 EPS and $757.84 million revenue, slightly missing estimates, alongside a recent quarterly dividend of $0.25 per share yielding 3.1%. The company maintains strong fundamentals with 16.71% return on equity.

title: Carter's to Close 150 Stores Amid Tariff Pressures
summary: Atlanta-based Carter’s announced it will shutter 150 stores nationwide over the next three years due to elevated product costs from tariffs and declining profitability, with Q3 net income dropping 80% to $11.6 million. The company plans $10 million in annual spending reductions and elimination of 300 office-based roles by end of 2025, representing a 15% workforce cut. CEO Douglas C. Palladini highlighted ongoing improvements in sales but noted impacts from tariffs and investments.

title: Cargill Plans $17.5M Expansion Project at Linden Grain Facility
summary: Cargill is seeking a 10-year tax abatement for a $17.5 million expansion at its Linden grain marketing facility, including new office space, grain bins, and conveyor systems. The project aims to increase capacity by 10 million bushels annually and address truck traffic backups. Completion is expected by July 2029.

title: Cargill's Revenue Hits 4-Year Low Amid Falling Crop Prices
summary: Cargill reported fiscal 2025 revenue of $154 billion, down from $160 billion in fiscal 2024 and the lowest since 2021, due to declining crop prices and a shrinking cattle herd. The company is restructuring by reducing business units and cutting 8,000 jobs. CEO Brian Sikes highlighted strategic decisions for growth amid industry challenges.

title: Cargill Officially Opens New Employee Housing in Fort Morgan
summary: Cargill has opened new employee housing in Fort Morgan to strengthen workforce support and continue investment in U.S. beef production. This initiative demonstrates the company's commitment to its employees and ongoing operations in the beef sector. The opening occurred on December 4, 2025.

title: Cargill to Lay Off 80 Minnesota Workers Amid Farm Slump

summary: BW Packaging announced a reorganization transitioning from three units—BW Flexible Systems, BW Filling & Closing, and BW Integrated Systems—into one product line-oriented structure to enhance collaboration, integrated solutions, and customer support worldwide. Existing contracts remain unaffected, with leadership emphasizing agility and forward-thinking services. The change unifies over 2,000 employees under the BW Packaging brand.

title: BW Packaging Launches Hayssen X850 Multi-Jaw Flow Wrapper
summary: BW Packaging, which includes BW Flexible Systems, launched the Hayssen X850 flow wrapper on December 1, 2025, designed for high-speed sealing of cheese and similar products with up to 300 packs per minute. Features include patented ring technology, quick-release jaws, jam detection, and advanced HMI for easier operation and maintenance. The product builds on the legacy Hayssen RT model with customer feedback-driven improvements.

title: BW Flexible Systems Merges Italian Operations Following $3 Million Facility Refurbishment
summary: BW Flexible Systems has merged its Italian operations by closing the Vicenza factory and consolidating teams at the renovated Mestrino manufacturing facility, which cost $3 million and includes new R&D center, training rooms, and sustainable upgrades. The move aims to streamline customer experience and foster innovation in packaging systems. Executives highlighted the facility's role in supporting growth and global partners.

title: BUA Group Disburses N30 Billion in Cash Awards to 510 Employees at 2025 Night of Excellence
summary: BUA Group honored 510 employees with N30 billion in cash awards during its 2025 Night of Excellence and Long Service Awards. NGX Group Chairman Umaru Kwairanga commended the company's leadership and employee dedication, attributing its success to people rather than just resources. The event highlighted long-term staff loyalty and corporate culture.

title: BUA Foods Announces New Sugar Factory 80% Complete
summary: BUA Foods, a subsidiary of BUA Group, reported that its new sugar factory is 80% complete as of December 16, 2025. This development aims to boost production capacity in the sugar industry. It represents significant progress in expanding manufacturing capabilities.

title: Arrowhead Milling Sells Facility to Panhandle Milling
summary: Arrowhead Milling sold its facility to Panhandle Milling, enabling the buyer to expand capabilities, product portfolio, and custom packaging solutions. This transaction represents a strategic divestiture for Arrowhead Mills, Inc. in the grain milling sector.

title: Arrowhead Mills Refreshes Brand with New Logo, Packaging, Website, and Two New Pancake Mixes
summary: Arrowhead Mills debuted a redesigned logo, refreshed packaging, revamped website, and two new SKUs: Organic Oat Flour Pancake & Waffle Mix (Gluten Free) and Organic Apple Cider Pancake & Waffle Mix (Limited-Edition). The update celebrates the brand's 50th anniversary and highlights that over 87% of products are USDA Certified Organic, aiming to attract new consumers while retaining loyalists. COO Dan Anglemyer emphasized the brand's commitment to organic agriculture and innovation.

summary: Ardent Mills will close its North Omaha (Nebraska) flour mill with 7,000 cwts daily capacity, a York, Pennsylvania mill, and a garbanzo bean plant in Steptoe, Washington, with operations winding down through 2025 and full closure by January 2026. The decisions stem from shifting market dynamics and competitive pressures, despite the Omaha North mill's 300+ years of history. The company plans to support affected employees with severance, transition services, and potential internal relocations while continuing investments in pulses.

summary: ADM's Board declared a 51.0 cents per share cash dividend, payable December 11, 2025, to shareholders of record on November 19, 2025. This marks the company's 376th consecutive quarterly dividend payment over 94 years.[4]

summary: ADM and Planters Cotton Oil Mill formed a joint venture for cottonseed processing, with ADM holding 60% stake. summary: ADM filed a WARN notice on December 19, 2025, to lay off 95 workers at its Memphis facility, with closure set for January 2026. The layoffs are linked to a new joint venture restructuring. This impacts operations at the North Memphis site.[2][5]

summary: ADM announced third quarter 2025 earnings supported by strong business execution, portfolio optimization, and robust cash flow. Inventors Rochus Mecke and Joachim Behrmann developed the technology under the International Patent Classification system managed by WIPO.

summary: Amandus Kahl will present innovative technologies at K 2025 in Düsseldorf for sustainable plastics processing, including dust-free dosing of polymer additives using flat die pellet mills like the 33-390 and 38-600 series. The company will also highlight solutions for recycling plastic waste with larger pellet mills such as the 39-1000 and 45-1250 to increase bulk density and prepare materials for chemical recycling.

title: Amandus Kahl GmbH & Co. KG Files Patent Application for Flat Die Press
summary: Amandus Kahl GmbH & Co. KG filed an international patent application (PCT/EP2025/063035) on May 13, 2025, for a 'Flat Die Press and Method for Processing a Material,' as announced on December 22, 2025. This filing highlights ongoing innovation in processing technology. The patent details were published recently in Geneva.

This change supports long-term innovation and market expansion. The leadership will drive strategic partnerships and new market entry alongside Amandus Kahl and other group entities.

summary: Reinartz GmbH & Co. KG, a machine factory with over 170 years of expertise in separation processes, has been acquired by the KAHL Group, which includes Amandus Kahl GmbH & Co. KG. The move aims to leverage synergies in technology, purchasing, sales, and innovation, particularly in alternative proteins, biomass processing, and mechanical drying. Reinartz will operate independently, retaining its name, site, and jobs, while collaborating with KAHL Group companies like Amandus Kahl.

summary: Alapala has successfully completed and delivered its turnkey Tayyaba Flour Mills project in Islamabad, Pakistan. This project demonstrates Alapala's capability in delivering high-quality milling solutions in South Asia. Dated December 4, 2025.

summary: Alapala has secured its second turnkey flour mill contract with Jordan's Shams Grain company. This deal underscores Alapala's growing presence in the Jordanian market and its expertise in delivering complete milling solutions. The contract was announced around December 15-16, 2025.

summary: Alapala Holding has formalized its second turnkey flour mill agreement with Shams Grain in Jordan, doubling the company's production capacity to 300 TPD. This deal strengthens Alapala's presence in the Middle East milling market. Published on December 15, 2025.
