summary: Alapala Holding Inc. is expanding the Marata Group's milling capacity to 2,200 tons per day following the successful operation of their existing 600 TPD facility. summary: The Argentine government announced reductions in export duties on grains including soybeans from 26.5% to 24%, corn and sorghum from 9.5% to 8.5%, and wheat and barley from 9.5% to 7.5%, effective upon publication in the Official Gazette. Gustavo Idigoras, president of CIARA-CEC—the chamber representing grain exporters and processors including APOSGRAN members—hailed the decision as highly valued by the agricultural sector, noting it restores profitability. The move supports President Milei's base in farming and agribusiness, though analysts predict limited immediate impact on domestic prices.

summary: Joseph Plante, previously division vice president and business unit manager for AMETEK Brookfield, has been appointed vice president and general manager of AMETEK’s Instrumentation & Specialty Controls division. This leadership change is part of broader executive updates at AMETEK.[1]

summary: AIB International has appointed Aaron K. Edwards as its new Chief Executive Officer, effective December 1, 2025, bringing nearly 30 years of experience in the food, beverage, and nutrition sectors. Edwards aims to accelerate value delivery, enhance food safety, regulatory compliance, and operational excellence for clients from startups to global brands. The appointment is praised by board members for positioning AIB to lead in a transforming global food supply chain.

summary: AGRA Industries has partnered with Carbon Clean via an MOU to integrate Carbon Clean's modular CaptureX technology into biofuel production, targeting CO2 capture during fermentation to lower carbon intensity and enable IRA tax credits like 45Z and 45Q. Executives from both companies highlighted the partnership's potential to reduce emissions and support the circular economy.

The company anticipates completing the required filings soon but notes risks of further restrictions if not filed within 60 days.

summary: Crunchbase reports over $100 billion invested in AI since ChatGPT's launch, with predictions of increased funding and nearly 30% of HumanX conference companies as acquisition targets next year.

summary: Google upgraded Gemini Deep Research based on Gemini 3 Pro, adding developer embedding via the new Interactions API for agentic applications. The tool improves factuality for due diligence and research, coinciding with OpenAI's GPT-5.2 release.

summary: On December 17, 2025, Google released Gemini 3 Flash and made it the default model in the Gemini app and Google Search's AI mode. This move intensifies competition with OpenAI amid surging market share.

summary: Tokyo-based startup Integral AI, founded by former Google AI engineers, announced on December 8, 2025, what it claims is the world’s first AGI-capable model, marking a departure from traditional scaling approaches. The announcement was covered by Business Wire and multiple tech outlets.

summary: AGCO plans to innovate with 3-5 new PTx products annually, accelerate sprayer rollout, execute Connected Cloud strategy, and expand distribution via full-line technology dealers and OEM partnerships including Fendt, Massey Ferguson, and Valtra. The PTx data platform's first offering launches in 2025, with full rollout by 2027, supported by specialized retrofit dealers and FarmerCore model shifting to farm-based service.

Updates include PTx data platform launch in 2025 and FarmerCore distribution model.

summary: ADM is closing its North Memphis cottonseed processing facility in January 2026 as part of a new joint venture with Planters Cotton Oil Mill in Arkansas. The closure impacts 95 employees, with a WARN notice filed on December 19. This move is tied to asset optimization strategy.

summary: General Mills launched a new playoff-season promotion pairing pricing investments with marketing to restore volume amid consumer pressure. summary: General Mills' North American pet segment saw sales rise 11% in Q2, attributed to recent acquisitions enhancing its position. Organic net sales declined only 1%, with North American retail volumes turning positive.

summary: General Mills plans to launch 10 new granola SKUs in January, capitalizing on double-digit growth in the category where it holds leadership despite granola being only 6% of its business. title: 2 Agriculture Reports Strong Profit Growth for Year Ended December 2024

The company is reinvesting profits into infrastructure and efficiency amid ongoing market challenges.
